Title#info: 1000 Genomes (Thousand Genomes) (A deep catalog of human genetic variation)
Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute, EBI, National Institutes of Health, National Human Genome Research Instituteï¿½, NHGRI, genome.gov, Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, Sanger, National Center for Biotechnology Information , NCBI
Subjects: Pharmacology, Human genetics
Description:
The 1000 Genomes Project is an international collaboration to produce an extensive public catalog of human genetic variation, including SNPs and structural variants, and their haplotype contexts. This resource will support genome-wide association studies and other medical research studies.
The genomes of about 2500 unidentified people from about 25 populations around the world will be sequenced using next-generation sequencing technologies. The results of the study will be freely and publicly accessible to researchers worldwide.
#name: 1000 Genomes (Thousand Genomes) (A deep catalog of human genetic variation)

Authority: 3TU.Federation of Technical Universities of the Netherlands
Subjects: Radar meteorology, Data archives, Cryoelectronics, Watershed hydrology, Hydrology, Climatology, Physics, Traffic flow, Land use
Description: A multidisciplinary data repository for a consortium of universities in the Netherlands housing over 5,000 datatsets. The focus is on scientific and technical datasets produced by Dutch researchers including datasets from doctoral research. Users can deposit up to 1G by completing an upload form. Future collection development foci include applied sciences, biomedical technology, earth sciences, and technology and construction.

Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, Columbia University, Lamont -Doherty Earth Observatory, LDEO, University of Texas at Austin, Institute for Geophysics, UTIG
Description: The Academic Seismic Portal (ASP) at UTIG serves up seismic and other data acquired on marine geology and geophysics cruises. Web access provides the public a unique opportunity to look beneath the world's ocean floor.

Authority: National Archives and Records Administration [NARA]
Subjects: Political activists, Social history, Government information
Description: The AAD is a database through the U.S. National Archives and Records Administration that allows users to search by keyword or category. Specific topics in personal history, private sectors, places, wars or time periods can be chosen to help filter your research findings of the 85 million electronic records that have been made available.

Authority: Central Food Technological Research Institute
Subjects: Food industry and trade, Peptide antibiotics, Peptide drugs, Peptide hormones
Description: ACEpepDB is a database ran by the Central Food Technological Research Institute. It contains records of about 865 peptides. Each record provides information on the food source, preparation,  purification and any other additional information. Each record includes the reference(s). The database provides a search and browsing option for a more personalized research experience.
Deposit: Accepting data from the internal users

Authority: Addgene
Subjects: Molecular biology, Plasmids--Research, Plasmids--Genetics, Plasmids, Sequence alignment (Bioinformatics)
Description:
Addgene is a non-profit organization dedicated to making it easier for scientists to share plasmids.
Addgene operates a plasmid repository for the research community. They work with laboratories to assemble a high-quality library of published and useful plasmids and their associated cloning/sequence data for use in research and discovery. By linking plasmids with articles, scientists can find data related to the materials they request.
Access: Limited (Some available to academic and non-profits only; for purchase)

Title#info: ADPSS Sociodata (Data Archive for Social Sciences)
Authority: University of Milan - Bicocca, Department of Sociology and Social Research
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: ADPSS-Sociodata is one of the most important Data Archive for the Social Sciences present in the Italian universities. Its aim is promoting social sciences data exchange, sharing and analysis.
#name: ADPSS Sociodata (Data Archive for Social Sciences)

Title#info: Adult Blood Lead Epidemiology and Surveillance (ABLES) Interactive Database
Authority: National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH)
Subjects: Blood, Lead, Occupational diseases
Description: ABLES provides data on lead exposure of adults in the United States.  The data comes from laboratory-reported elevated blood lead levels.
#name: Adult Blood Lead Epidemiology and Surveillance (ABLES) Interactive Database

Title#info: Advanced Cooperative Arctic Data and Information Service (ACADIS)
Authority: National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC), National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR), University Corporation for Atmospheric Research (UCAR)
Subjects: Arctic Regions, Permafrost, Biology, Oceanography, Cryosphere, Sea ice, Arctic peoples, Atmosphere, Remote sensing, Biogeochemistry, Glaciers, Physical sciences
Description: The Advanced Cooperative Arctic Data and Information Service (ACADIS) program includes data management services.  ACADIS is also a repository for Arctic research data. Data include long-term observational timeseries, local, regional, and system-scale research from many diverse domains.
#name: Advanced Cooperative Arctic Data and Information Service (ACADIS)

Title#info: Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer [ASTER]
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Climatology, Cartography, Earth sciences, Maps, Topographical surveying, Geospatial data
Description:
The Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer (ASTER) is an imaging instrument onboard Terra, the flagship satellite of NASA's Earth Observing System (EOS). 
The ASTER project collects and archives data to create detailed maps of land surface temperature, reflectance, and elevation.  The ASTER project is a collaboration between NASA and the Japanese government to develop a scientific understanding of the Earth.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer [ASTER]

Title#info: Africa Centre for Health and Population Studies
Authority: University of KwaZulu-Natal, College of Health Sciences
Subjects: Biology, Demography, Economics, HIV infections, Medicine
Description: The Africa Centre offers longitudinal datasets from a rural demographic in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa where HIV prevalence is extremely high. The data may be filtered by demographics, years, or by individuals questionnaires. The Africa Centre requests notification that anyone contact them when downloading their data.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Africa Centre for Health and Population Studies

Title#info: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)
Authority: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
Subjects: Medical policy, Health care reform--U.S. states, Health insurance, Human anatomy, Health
Description: These datasets are made available by the United States Department of Health and Human Services, Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality. This agency includes the Systematic Review Data Repository and data sources on healthcare cost, quality, and accessibility, emergency room visits, hospitalization, and medical insurance.
#name: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

Authority: University of Guelph
Subjects: Agriculture--Environmental aspects, Agriculture
Description: The Agri-Environmental Research Data Repository includes datasets from several studies conducted by researchers at the University of Guelph. This repository includes data on topics such as crop yield, soil moisture, weather and agroforestry.
Reuse: Terms of use are explained for each study.

Authority: Chinese Academy of Agriculture Sciences
Subjects: Agriculture
Description: Agricultural Scientific Data Sharing Center is one of platforms funded by National Science and Technology Infrastructure program, a nation-level program for S&T resources open, cosharing and utilization efficiently. This center includes data on topics such as crop yield, zoology, agriculture regionalization, fishery and prataculture.

Authority: AidData Partners
Subjects: Economic assistance, Economic development
Description: AidData contains information about international economic development assistance, dating back to 1947. AidData provides a searchable database of nearly one million past and present aid activities around the world, aid information management services and tools, data visualization technologies, and research designed to increase understanding of development finance. AidData is searchable by topic such as disaster prevention, energy supply, water supply or reconstruction relief. You may also search by specific regions including Africa, Europe, America, Asia, or Oceania.

Authority: Australian Institute of Marine Science
Subjects: Marine sciences, Reefs
Description: The Australian Institute of Marine Science (AIMS) is a tropical marine research center. Data are available on topics including reef weather, sea temperature, cyclones, and water quality.
Access: Open. Access to some data will be via legal data agreement.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: International Atomic and Molecular Data Centre network, A+M & PMI Data Centre Network , International Atomic Energy Agency, IAEA
Description:
Numerical database of atomic and molecular processes and particle-surface interactions. ALADDIN has formatted data on atomic structure and spectra (energy levels,wave lengths, and transition probabilities); electron and heavy particle collisions with atoms, ions, and molecules (cross sections and/or rate coefficients, including, in most cases, analytic fit to the data); sputtering of surfaces by impact of main plasma constituents and self
sputtering; particle reflection from surfaces; thermophysical and thermomechanical properties of beryllium and pyrolytic graphites.

Authority: Geophysical Institute, University of Alaska Fairbanks
Subjects: Climatology, Meteorology
Description: The Alaska Climate Research Center archives and provides digital climate records, climate statistics, and monthly weather summaries on Alaska and the polar regions. The Alaska Climate Research Center is part of the Geophysical Institute at the University of Alaska Fairbanks.
Deposit: Membership in University of Alaska affiliated organization

Authority: Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS)
Subjects: Coastal ecology, Marine ecology, Oceanography
Description: Alaska Ocean Observing System (AOOS) provides ocean and coastal observations data.  The AOOS is governed by  the Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS) which is an international organization that partners federal, regional, academic and private sector groups.
Deposit: Membership in Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS) research organizations

Title#info: Alaska Satellite Facility - Synthetic Aperture Radar Distributed Active Archive Center
Authority: Alaska Satellite Facility, Geophysical Institute, University of Alaska [Fairbanks, AK]
Subjects: Remote sensing, Earth resources technology satellites
Description: The Alaska Satellite Facility (ASF) of the Geophysical Institute at the University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF), downlinks, processes, archives, and distributes remote-sensing data to scientific users around the world.
Reuse: Open and closed; see http://www.asf.alaska.edu/program/sdc/data for access info on restricted and unrestricted data sets.
#name: Alaska Satellite Facility - Synthetic Aperture Radar Distributed Active Archive Center

Authority: Energy Resources Conservation Board, Alberta Geology Survey, AGS
Description: Alberta Geological Survey provides geological information to help with the exploration, development and conservation of Alberta's resources

Title#info: ALLBUS (Allgemeine Bevï¿½lkerungsumfrage der Sozialwissenschaften) (German General Social Survey)
Authority: GESIS FDZ ALLBUS, RatSWD
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: The German General Social Survey (ALLBUS) collects up-to-date data on attitudes, behavior, and social structure in Germany. Every two years since 1980 a representative cross section of the population is surveyed using both constant and variable questions. The ALLBUS data become available to interested parties for research and teaching as soon as they are processed and documented.
#name: ALLBUS (Allgemeine Bevï¿½lkerungsumfrage der Sozialwissenschaften) (German General Social Survey)

Title#info: Alternative Fuels and Advanced Vehicles Data Center (AFDC)
Authority: Alternative Fuels and Advanced Vehicles Data Center, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, U.S. Department of Energy [
Subjects: Clean energy industries, Alternative fuel vehicles, Biodiesel fuels, Electricity in transportation, Ethanol as fuel, Natural gas, Propane as fuel, Vehicles, Fuel, Transportation, Petroleum as fuel
Description: The Alternative Fuels Data Center (AFDC) is a comprehensive clearinghouse of information about advanced transportation technologies. The AFDC offers transportation decision makers unbiased information, data, and tools related to the deployment of alternative fuels and advanced vehicles. The AFDC was originally a repository for alternative fuel performance data, but has since evolved to offer a broad array of  resources that support the efforts to reduce petroleum use in transportation.
#name: Alternative Fuels and Advanced Vehicles Data Center (AFDC)

Authority: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, WHOI, Keck Foundation
Description: The Alvin Frame-Grabber system provides the NDSF community on-line access to Alvin's video imagery co-registered with vehicle navigation and attitude data for shipboard analysis, planning deep submergence research cruises, and synoptic review of data post-cruise. The system is built upon the methodology and technology developed for the JasonII Virtual Control Van and a prototype system that was deployed on 13 Alvin dives in the East Pacific Rise and the Galapagos (AT7-12, AT7-13). The deployed prototype system was extremely valuable in facilitating real-time dive planning, review, and shipboard analysis.

Authority: Amazon.com
Subjects: Geography, Mathematics, Encyclopedias and dictionaries, Economics, Climatology, Chemistry, Biology, Astronomy, Data archives
Description: Public Data Sets on AWS provides a centralized repository of public data sets that can be seamlessly integrated into AWS cloud-based applications. AWS is hosting the public data sets at no charge to their users. Anyone can access these data sets from their Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances and start computing on the data within minutes. Users can also leverage the entire AWS ecosystem and easily collaborate with other AWS users.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit (Private submissions welcome)

Authority: U.S. Census Bureau [Washington D.C.]
Subjects: Population, Household surveys, Income, Census
Description: American FactFinder, maintained by the U.S. Census Bureau, is a source for United States population, housing, economic, and geographic data. The Census Bureau conducts nearly one hundred surveys and censuses every year. Note that by law, no one is permitted to reveal information from these censuses and surveys that could identify any person, household, or business.
Reuse: Open; see http://factfinder2.census.gov/faces/nav/jsf/pages/what_we_provide2.xhtml for information on data available for download.

Authority: American Geosciences Institute [Alexandria, VA]
Subjects: Geological libraries, Geology, Earth sciences, Geological repositories, Groundwater ecology, Soil conservation
Description:
GeoRef is the most comprehensive database in the geosciences and continues to grow by more than 100,000 references a year. The database contains over 3.3 million references to geoscience journal articles, books, maps, conference papers, reports and theses. The GeoRef database covers the geology of North America from 1669 to the present and the geology of the rest of the world from 1933 to the present. The database includes references to all publications of the U.S. Geological Survey. Masters' theses and doctoral dissertations from U.S. and Canadian universities are also covered.
GeoRef provides free access to materials currently being processed for inclusion in the database, as well as indexed open-access resources. You can gain full subscription access to this vast amount of information online, or on GeoRef CDs.

Authority: Mineralogical Society of America [Chantilly, VA]
Subjects: Minerals, Mineralogy
Description: AMCSED is an interface to a crystal structure database that includes every structure published in the American Mineralogist, The Canadian Mineralogist, European Journal of Mineralogy and Physics and Chemistry of Minerals, as well as selected datasets from other journals. The database is maintained under the care of the Mineralogical Society of America and the Mineralogical Association of Canada, and financed by the National Science Foundation. You may search by a mineral of your choice, or choose a mineral from a complete list to help aid your research.

Authority: National Science Foundation (NSF), Stanford University, University of Michigan
Subjects: Elections, Census, Voting age, Voting, Voting research, Public opinion, Political participation, Partisanship, Ideology, Presidential candidates, Political candidates
Description:
The American National Election Studies (ANES) conducts national surveys and pilot studies and provides large, multifaceted datasets.
	Time Series Studies are conducted during years of national elections, with pre-election and post-election surveys conducted in presidential election years and post-election surveys conducted during congressional election years. Pilot Studies are normally conducted in years when there is no national election and are designed to test new, or to refine existing, instrumentation and study designs. Other Major Data Collections includes panel studies and other special studies.
Reuse: Open. âHow to Cite ANES Resourcesâ: http://electionstudies.org/nesguide/citation.htm

Authority: The Latin American Public Opinion Project, Vanderbilt University [Nashville, TN], University of Costa Rica
Subjects: Public opinion polls, Political geography, Democracy, Political science
Description: AmericasBarometer surveys are multi-country, regularly conducted surveys of democratic values and behaviors in the Americas. The raw data are available for free at all LAPOP consortium member institutions, and by subscription at libraries throughout the world.
Reuse: Subscriber; see http://www.vanderbilt.edu/lapop/request-datasets.php for purchase and free access options.

Authority: National Animal Genome Research Program, Bioinformatics Coordination Program, NAGRP, USDA NRSP-8 Program, Iowa State University, ISU, United States Department of Agriculture, National Institute of Food and Agriculture, USDA - NIFA, Huazhong Agriculture University
Subjects: Zoology
Description: This Animal Quantitative Trait Loci (QTL) database (Animal QTLdb) is designed to house all publicly available QTL and trait mapping data (i.e. trait and genome location association data; collectively called "QTL data" on this site) on livestock animal species for easily locating and making comparisons within and between species. New database tools are continuely added to align the QTL and association data to other types of genome information, such as annotated genes, RH / SNP markers, and human genome maps. Besides the QTL data from species listed below, the QTLdb is open to house QTL/association date from other animal species where feasible. Note that the JAS along with other journals, now require that new QTL/association data be entered into a QTL database as part of their publication requirements.

Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, Columbia University, Lamont -Doherty Earth Observatory, LDEO
Description: The Antarctic and Southern Ocean Data Portal, part of the US Antarctic Data Consortium, provides access to geoscience data, primarily marine, from the Antarctic region. The synthesis began in 2003 as the Antarctic Multibeam Bathymetry and Geophysical Data Synthesis (AMBS) with a focus on multibeam bathymetry field data and other geophysical data from the Southern Ocean collected with the R/V N. B. Palmer. In 2005, the effort was expanded to include all routine underway geophysical and oceanographic data collected with both the R/V N. B. Palmer and R/V L. Gould, the two primary research vessels serving the US Antarctic Program.

Authority: Australian National Data Service, ANDS, Australian National University, Division of Information, ANU, IARU, International Alliance of Research Universities, Group of Eight Australia, Go8
Subjects: Biology, Humanities
Description:
The Australian National University undertake work to collect and publish metadata about research data held by ANU, and in the case of four discipline areas, Earth Sciences, Astronomy, Phenomics and Digital Humanities to develop pipelines and tools to enable the publication of research data using a common and repeatable approach. Aims and outcomes: To identify and describe research data held at ANU, to develop a consistent approach to the publication of metadata on the University's data holdings
Identification and curation of significant orphan data sets that might otherwise be lost or inadvertently destroyed, to develop a culture of data data sharing and data re-use.
Reuse: closed; other - http://libguides.anu.edu.au/content.php?pid=372387&sid=3050562; other - http://libguides.anu.edu.au/content.php?pid=372387&sid=3134975; CC - http://creativecommons.org/; Copyrights - http://libguides.anu.edu.au/content.php?pid=372387&sid=3050535; Copyrights - http://legaloffice.weblogs.anu.edu.au/content/copyright/
Deposit: restricted: registration; Data Deposit Requirements of Selected Science Journals  - http://libguides.anu.edu.au/content.php?pid=372387&sid=3050531

Authority: Department of Plant Biology, Carnegie Institution for Science [Stanford, CA]
Subjects: DNA, Molecular biology, Arabidopsis thaliana
Description: The Arabidopsis Information Resource collects information and maintains a database of genetic and molecular biology data for Arabidopsis thaliana, a widely used model plant. Data available from TAIR includes the complete genome sequence along with gene structure, gene product information, metabolism, gene expression, DNA and seed stocks, genome maps, genetic and physical markers, publications, and information about the Arabidopsis research community.
Reuse: Open; see http://www.arabidopsis.org/about/index.jsp for info on downloading datasets, etc.

Authority: University of York
Subjects: Archaeology
Description: Archaeology Data Service (ADS) provides archaeological data from the early prehistoric to present in faceted classification categories as event, evidence, maritime, monument types, and object types. ADS also provides archives that are a separate faceted collection including literature, journals, bibliographies, and theses.  ADS data and archives are provided by a consortium of research institutions dedicated to providing data for archaeological research.

Title#info: ARM Data Archive (Atmospheric Radiation Measurement Climate Research Facility Data Archive)
Authority: U.S. Department of Energy, Office of Science, DOE, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, ORNL, Atmospheric Radiation Measurement Climate Research Facility, ARM, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, LBL, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, LLNL, National Renewable Energy  Laboratory, NREL, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, PNL, Sandia National Laboratories, Sandia, Argonne National Laboratory, ANL, Brookhaven National Laboratory, BNL, Los Alamos National Laboratory, LANL
Description: The ARM Climate Research Facility Data Archive provides long-term storage and access for all data generated by ARM or collected by ARM from related program (e.g., external data such as NASA satellite. ARM program has generated billions of measurements of radiation, radiative transfer, meteorology, clouds, etc.  data).
Deposit: restricted: registration; data sharing and distribution policy  - http://www.arm.gov/data/docs/policy
#name: ARM Data Archive (Atmospheric Radiation Measurement Climate Research Facility Data Archive)

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK]
Subjects: Gene expression, Functional genomics
Description: The ArrayExpress Archive is a database of functional genomics experiments including gene expression where you can query and download data collected to MIAME and MINSEQE standards. Gene Expression Atlas contains a subset of curated and re-annotated Archive data which can be queried for individual gene expression under different biological conditions across experiments.

With ARS - Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance in Germany - the infrastructure for a nationwide surveillance of antimicrobial resistance has been established, which covers both the inpatient medical care and the ambulatory care sector. This is intended to reliable data on the epidemiology of antimicrobial resistance in Germany and differential statements provided by structural features of the health care and by region are possible. ARS is designed as a laboratory-based surveillance system for continuous collection of resistance data from routine for the full range of clinically relevant bacterial pathogens. Project participants and thus data suppliers are laboratories that analyze samples of medical facilities and doctors' offices microbiologically.

Authority: King's College, London, UK
Subjects: Local history, Archaeology, English literature, Language and languages, Linguistics, Arts, Performing arts
Description: The Arts and Humanities Data Service [AHDS] was a UK national service aiding the discovery, creation and preservation of digital resources in the arts and humanities. Their collection covers history, archaeology, literature, languages & linguistics, visual and performing arts.  National funding stopped in 2009.

Authority: ARTstor, Inc.
Subjects: Anthropological archives, Sculpture, Photography, Painting, Architecture, Museums, Art, Archaeological archives, Decorative arts
Description: The ARTstor Digital Library is a nonprofit resource that provides more than one million digital images in the arts, architecture, humanities, and sciences with an accessible suite of software tools for teaching and research. Its community-built collections comprise contributions from outstanding international museums, photographers, libraries, scholars, photo archives, and artists and artists' estates.
Reuse: Terms and conditions for different content are posted.

Authority: The Association of Religion Data Archives (University Park, PA)
Subjects: Presbyterians, Unitarians, Nazarenes (Church of the Nazarene), Mormons, Methodists, Lutherans, Jewish religious education, Catholics, Baptists, Adventists, Religions, Religion
Description: The ARDA provides free access to the most authoritative religion data and religion statistics. It is a collection of surveys, polls, and other data submitted by researchers and made available online by the ARDA

Title#info: ASTM International (American Society for Testing and Materials)
Authority: ASTM International, American Society for Testing and Materials
Subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Economics
Description: ASTM International, formerly known as the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM), is a globally recognized leader in the development and delivery of international voluntary consensus standards. Today, some 12,000 ASTM standards are used around the world to improve product quality, enhance safety, facilitate market access and trade, and build consumer confidence.
#name: ASTM International (American Society for Testing and Materials)

Authority: Astronomical Data Archives Center, National Astronomical Observatory of Japan [Mitaka, Tokyo; Japan]
Subjects: Astronomy, Spectroscopic imaging, Photometry, Astrographic catalog and chart, Observatories, Trigonometrical functions, Planets, Astrophysics, Space sciences, Astronomical instruments
Description: The Astronomical Data Archives Center (ADAC) provides access to astronomical data from all over the world with links to online data catalogs, journal archives, imaging services and data archives. Users can access the VizieR catalogue service as well as the Hubble Ultra Deep Field Data by requesting password access. ADAC also provides access to the SMOKA public science data obtained through the Subaru Telescope in Hawaii as well as Schmidt Telescope at the University of Tokyo & MITSuME and KANATA Telescope at Higashi-Hiroshima Observatory. Users may need to contact the ADAC for password access or create user accounts for the various data services accessible through the ADAC site.
Reuse: Open for academic research and educational purposes only

Authority: Mount Allison University
Subjects: Conservation of natural resources, Plants, Animals, Biotic communities, Botany, Zoology, Landscape ecology, Forests and forestry, Ecology
Description: The Atlantic Canada Conservation Data Centre (CDC) maintains comprehensive lists of plant and animal species. The Atlantic CDC has over 635,000 geo-located records of species occurrences and over 40,000 records of extremely rare to uncommon species in the Atlantic region, including New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Newfoundland, and Labrador. The Atlantic CDC also maintains biological and other types of data in a variety of linked databases.
Access: Open. Restrictions: http://www.accdc.com/Products/fineprint.html. Fees may apply: http://www.accdc.com/Products/fees.html

Title#info: Atlantic Oceanographic and Meteorological Laboratory [AOML] Environmental Data Server (ENVIDS)
Authority: Atlantic Oceanographic and Meterological Laboratory, National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration [Washington, DC]
Subjects: Ocean, Hurricanes, Atmosphere
Description: The AOML Environmental Data Server (ENVIDS) provides interactive, on-line access to various oceanographic and atmospheric datasets residing at AOML. The in-house datasets include Atlantic Expendable Bathythermograph (XBT), Global Lagrangian Drifting Buoy, Hurricane Flight Level, and Atlantic Hurricane Tracks (North Atlantic Best Track and Synoptic). Other available datasets include Pacific Conductivitiy/Temperature/Depth Recorder (CTD) and World Ocean Atlas 1998.
Reuse: See http://www.aoml.noaa.gov/data/ for info on data sets available.
#name: Atlantic Oceanographic and Meteorological Laboratory [AOML] Environmental Data Server (ENVIDS)

Authority: Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO)
Subjects: Biodiversity, Images, Photographic, DNA, Conservation of natural resources, Insects, Microorganisms, Plants, Mammals, Birds, Reptiles, Amphibians, Invertebrates, Fishes
Description: The Atlas of Living Australia (ALA) combines and provides scientifically collected data from a wide range of sources such as museums, herbaria, community groups, government departments, individuals and universities.  Data records consist of images, literature, molecular DNA data, identification keys, species interaction data, species profile data, nomenclature, source data, conservation indicators, and spatial data.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit (Private submissions welcome); http://www.ala.org.au/get-involved/

Title#info: Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility Data Archive
Authority: ARM Climate Research Center, Office of Science, U.S. Department of Energy [Washington, DC]
Subjects: Climatology, Atmospheric radiation, Cloud forecasting
Description: The ARM Archive supports the scientific field experiments of the Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Program by storing and distributing the large quantities of data collected from these experiments. These data are used to research atmospheric radiation balance and cloud feedback processes, which are critical to the understanding of global climate change.
Reuse: Open, see http://www.archive.arm.gov/armlogin/login.jsp for info on data can be acquired.
#name: Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility Data Archive

Authority: Atmospheric Science Data Center, NASA Langley Research Center [Langley, VA]
Subjects: Earth sciences, Climatology, Ecology, Atmospheric chemistry, Solar activity
Description: The Atmospheric Science Data Center (ASDC) at NASA Langley Research Center is responsible for the processing, archival, and distribution of NASA Earth science data in the areas of radiation budget, clouds, aerosols, and tropospheric chemistry. The ASDC specializes in atmospheric data important to understanding the causes and processes of global climate change and the consequences of human activities on the climate.

Title#info: Atomic and Molecular Data Information System (AMDIS) (provided by the Nuclear Data Section)
Authority: Intemational Atomic Energy Agency, IAEA, Intemational Atomic and Molecular Data Centre network, A+M & PMI Data Centre Network
Description: The Atomic and Molecular Data Unit operates within the Nuclear Data Section of the International Atomic Energy Agency, Vienna, Austria.The primary objective of the Atomic and Molecular Data Unit is to establish and maintain internationally recommended numerical databases on atomic and molecular collision and radiative processes, atomic and molecular structure characteristics, particle-solid surface interaction processes and physico-chemical and thermo-mechanical material properties for use in fusion energy research and other plasma science and technology applications.
#name: Atomic and Molecular Data Information System (AMDIS) (provided by the Nuclear Data Section)

Title#info: Atomic and Molecular Data Research Center (AMDRC)
Authority: National Institute for Fusion Science, Coordination Research Center , NIFS, Coordination Reserach Center
Description:
Our center is devoted to: Collection, compilation, evaluation, and dissemination of scientific information required for fusion research, and
Investigation of problems arising in the course of development of fusion research. There are atomic and molecular (A & M) numerical databases and bibliographic databases on plasma physics and atomic physics.
#name: Atomic and Molecular Data Research Center (AMDRC)

Authority: Australian Government, Department of Sustainability, Environment, Water, Population and Communities
Subjects: Geography, Geographic information systems, Aerial photographs, Maps, Remote-sensing images, Biodiversity, Sea ice, Scientific expeditions
Description: The Australian Antarctic Data Centre (AADC) provides data collection and data management services in Australia's Antarctic Science Program. The AADC manages science data from Australia's Antarctic research, maps Australia's areas of interest in the Antarctic region, manages Australia's Antarctic state of the environment reporting, and provides advice and education and a range of other products.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Consortium of Australian universities managed by Australian National University
Subjects: Social sciences, Census, Demography, Census districts, Economics, Political science
Description: ADA provides a national service for the collection and preservation of computer readable data relating to social, political and economic affairs in Australia. It also plays an important role on behalf of the Australian Research Council (ARC) through the management and dissemination of ARC funded data collections arising from Discovery and Linkage grants.

Title#info: Australian Ecological and Knowledge Observation System (AEKOS)
Authority: TERN Eco-informatics1609
Subjects: Australia, Mammals--Ecology, Animal ecology--Data processing, Plant ecology--Data processing, Plant diversity, Plant communities--Ecology, Vegetation surveys--Methodology, Ecology projects, Ecological surveys--Technique, Ecological surveys--Methodology, Ecological surveys, Ecological reserves, Ecological disturbances, Ecological assessment (Biology)--Mathematical models, Ecological assessment (Biology), Ecology--Databases
Description:
The Australian Ecological and Knowledge Observation System (ÃKOS) Data Portal is a data and âresearch methodsâ knowledge base of Australiaâs land-dwelling plants, animals and their environments. It was built to meet the needs of the ecosystem science, tertiary education and natural resource management sectors. 

There are currently about 140,000 records on plants in plots for 93,000 sites and associated environmental data (November 2014). There will be regular updates to the Portal over the coming months with offers of more vegetation databases and our first offer of fauna databases as indicated in the table. 

Users can find, view, explore and download source ecological âplotâ data from 1923 to present in unprecedented detail never experienced previously. You can access data by dataset or integrated across study site(s), comparing `like` with `like`. This repository emphasizes reuse of data and therefore provides rich, detailed descriptions to enable appropriate reuse. You can also view the study sites using the Map Search.  The data are high quality having been quality assured using best practice to minimise misuse. It has been collected systematically by ecological researchers (government, universities) to answer scientific questions or identify environmental solutions. All sampling methods are robust plot-based such as quadrats, releves, transects, animal trapping arrays and other scientific methods. The repository does not contain data sampled haphazardly.
#name: Australian Ecological and Knowledge Observation System (AEKOS)

Authority: Australian National Corpus Incorporated
Subjects: Linguistic analysis (Linguistics), Terms and phrases, Frequency (Linguistics)
Description: The Australian National Corpus collates and provides access to assorted examples of Australian English text, transcriptions, audio and audio-visual materials.  Text analysis tools are embedded in the interface allowing analysis and downloads in *.CSV format.

Authority: Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS)
Subjects: Climatology, Ocean--Maps, Australia, Marine sciences
Description: Australian Ocean Data Network (AODN) provides data collected by the Australian marine community. AODN's data is searchable via map interface and metadata catalogue. AODN is Australia's exhaustive repository for marine and climate data.

Title#info: Australian Repositories for Diffraction ImageS, The (TARDIS)
Authority: Monash University
Subjects: Molecular biology, Crystallography, Synchrotrons
Description: TARDIS (The Australian Repositories for Diffraction ImageS) points users to crystallography data in external locations (diffraction images) and provides metadata for citation in publications.  TARDIS is scheduled to be replaced by the Bioscience Data Platform (https://www.nectar.org.au/bioscience-data-platform-tardis-cloud).
#name: Australian Repositories for Diffraction ImageS, The (TARDIS)

Authority: Consoria managed by Australian National University (ANU) [Canberra, AU]
Subjects: Economic history, Australian states--Politics and government, Social history
Description: ASSDA provides a national service for the collection and preservation of computer readable data relating to social, political and economic affairs within Australia and to make these data available for further analysis
Reuse: Open; See http://www.assda.edu.au/data.html for information on accessing data.
Deposit: See http://www.assda.edu.au/depositing.html for info on depositing data.

Title#info: Banco de Informaciï¿½n para la Investigaciï¿½n Aplicada en Ciencias Sociales, Repositorio Institucional (BIIACS)
Authority: Centro de Investigacion y Docenia Economicas, A.C.
Subjects: Jurisprudence, Geography, Political science, Economics, Social sciences
Description:
The Information Bank for Applied Research in Social Sciences (BIIACS) Central aims to provide strategic information services for the investigation and resolution of social problems and conduct rigorous analysis of databases and provide advice to decision-makers. To provide efficient access to information, the BIIACS conducted five major activities: collects, protects, preserves, and disseminates cure databases.
The databases are available online and for free. They are organized in communities and collections with diverse content ranging from information on various economic, political and social of Mexico in different periods of federal government until election survey results conducted by higher education institutions as the CIDE and pollsters as Mund Americas.
Access: open; other - BSD Open Source license
#name: Banco de Informaciï¿½n para la Investigaciï¿½n Aplicada en Ciencias Sociales, Repositorio Institucional (BIIACS)

Title#info: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes (MAST) (Multimission Archive at STScI)
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration, NASA, Space Telescope Science Institute , STScI
Description: The Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes (MAST) is a NASA funded project to support and provide to the astronomical community a variety of astronomical data archives, with the primary focus on scientifically related data sets in the optical, ultraviolet, and near-infrared parts of the spectrum. MAST is located at the Space Telescope Science Institute (STScI).
Deposit: restricted: other; Guidelines for Contributing High-Level Science Products to the Multimission Archive at STScI  - http://archive.stsci.edu/hlsp/hlsp_guidelines.html
#name: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes (MAST) (Multimission Archive at STScI)

Authority: International Barcode of Life Project (iBOL)
Subjects: Bacteria, Fungi, Plants, Microorganisms, Taxonomists, Biology, DNA, Molecular biology, Bioinformatics
Description: The Barcode of Life Data Systems (BOLD) provides DNA barcode data. BOLD's online workbench supports data validation, annotation, and publication for specimen, distributional, and molecular data.

Authority: Barrow Arctic Science Consortium (BASC)
Subjects: Barrow (Alaska), North Slope (Alaska), Geospatial data
Description: BAID is a suite of online, interactive maps and services that support Arctic science with a special focus on the research hubs of Barrow, and surrounding areas on the North Slope of Alaska. In 2000 the BAID project began as a Microsoft Access database which was used to centralize information about research plots mapped with BASC's new DGPS system. Today BAID includes the locations of over 10,000 research plots and instrument locations dating back to the 1940s.

Authority: Earth System Research Laboratory (ESRL), Global Monitoring Division (GMD)
Subjects: Ozone, Greenhouse gases, Aerosols, Ozone, Greenhouse effect, Atmospheric, Climatology, Meteorology
Description: The Barrow, Alaska Observatory (BRW) archives and provides digital access to their findings related to climate change, ozone depletion and baseline air quality.  The BRW is part of the National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration and Earth System Research Laboratory Global Monitoring Division.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: LESIA - Observatoire de Paris
Subjects: Astronomy, Heliograph, Solar activity, Synoptic meteorology, Spectroheliograph, Coronagraphs, Stars, Solar wind, Luminescence spectroscopy
Description: BASS2000 archives ground-based solar survey data, and a long term data from France's observatories.  The database contains spectroheliographs, radioheliographs, coronographs, and synoptic maps. BASS2000 provides data as GIF, PNG, JPEG, MPEG, PS, and Compressed Files.
Access: Open; access for research and education
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions) - http://bass2000.obspm.fr/related_topics.php

Authority: CLARIN-D, Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure - D
Subjects: Linguistics
Description: The Bavarian Archive for Speech Signals (BAS) is a public institution hosted by the University of Munich. This institution was founded with the aim of making corpora of current spoken German available to both the basic research and the speech technology communities via a maximally comprehensive digital speech-signal database. The speech material will be structured in a manner allowing flexible and precise access, with acoustic-phonetic and linguistic-phonetic evaluation forming an integral part of it.

Title#info: Beaufort/Chukchi Seas Mesoscale Meteorology Modeling Study
Authority: University of Alaska
Subjects: Buoys, Atmospheric circulation, Modeling, Weather, Meteorology, Mesospheric circulation, Atmosphere, Meteorological instruments, Ocean circulation
Description: This site makes project data available from a modeling study along with associated publications. Mesoscale weather patterns and wind field features in the Beaufort sea and associated coastal areas are measured in order to evaluate dispersal patterns for oils spills.
#name: Beaufort/Chukchi Seas Mesoscale Meteorology Modeling Study

Authority: Elsik Laboratory, University of Missouri
Subjects: Entomology, Genomics, Bees, Honey, Beehives, Insects, Bee pollen, Bee products, Bee culture, Pollination, Pollination by bees, Pollinators
Description: BeeBase provides gene sequences and genomes of Bombus terrestris, B. impatiens, Apis mellifera and three of its pathogens. BeeBase data is discoverable and analyzed via genome browsers, blast search, and apollo annotation tool.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Kansas State University Bioinformatics Center
Subjects: Insects, Beetles, Developmental biology, Genomics, Genetics, Entomology
Description: BeetleBase is a comprehensive sequence database and important community resource for Tribolium genetics, genomics and developmental biology. It provides genetic data on the Tribolium Castaneum, Red Flour Beetle, as gene maps, official gene set, reference sequences, predicted models, and whole-genome tiling array representing developmental stages.

Title#info: Beta Cell Biology Consortium Reagent and Data Resources (BCBC Reagent and Data Resources)
Authority: National Institutes of Health, NIH, Vanderbilt University, Beta Cell Biology Consortium, Coordinating Center, BCBC, National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases, NIDDK, U.S.Department of Health & Human Services, , HHS, Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation International, JDRF
Description: The Beta Cell Biology Consortium (BCBC) website provides online information, communication, and resources of interest to beta cell biologist and the scientific community at large.
#name: Beta Cell Biology Consortium Reagent and Data Resources (BCBC Reagent and Data Resources)

Title#info: Better Access to Data for Global Interdisciplinary Research (BADGIR)
Authority: University of Wisconsin
Subjects: Slave trade, Demographic surveys, Americans, Central Americans, South Americans, Data archives, Demographic surveys, Ecology, Health, Social sciences, Aging, Statistics
Description: From this portal you can browse or search data documentation (e.g., metadata, codebooks) and univariate summary statistics (e.g., mean, frequency counts). The database contains documented survey results from various survey-research projects in the US, Central America, and South America. Some historical datasets also (e.g. of slave-trade records).
#name: Better Access to Data for Global Interdisciplinary Research (BADGIR)

Authority: Natural Environment Research Council, NERC, British Geological Survey, BGS
Description: GeoScenic offers access to images from the vast collections of geological photographs in BGS.

Authority: Leibniz Institute of Plant Biochemistry, Research Group Mass spectroscopy and Bioinformatics
Subjects: Biology
Description: BioInvestigation Index database enables storing and querying functionalities of experimental biological and biomedical metadata of Leibniz Institute of Plant Biochemistry

Authority: BHL Consortium; http://biodivlib.wikispaces.com/BHL Consortium Membership
Subjects: Scientific illustration, Botany, Biology, Natural history, Biodiversity, Extinct animals, Herbaria, Ecology, Botanical libraries
Description: The Biodiversity Library is an international consortium of natural history and botanical libraries that has assembled and digitized the world's largest collection of legacy literature in biodiversity. It also serves as the foundational literature component of the Encyclopedia of Life. Browse by author, title, subject, collection, map, year, language, and contributor. Taxonomic search using UBio. Also supports data export and a variety of machine interfaces.

Authority: Institute of Botany, CAS
Subjects: Biology, Biodiversity
Description: The Biodiversity Heritage Library-China is one node of the international consortium of natural history and botanical libraries. It also serves as the foundational literature component of the Encyclopedia of Life. Browse by author, title, subject, collection, map, year, language, and contributor. Taxonomic search using UBio. Also supports data export and a variety of machine interfaces.

Authority: BioGrid Australia Management Committee
Subjects: Diabetes, Cystic fibrosis, Cancer, Population, Oncology, Imaging systems in medicine, Neurosciences, Endocrinology, Health, Medicine
Description: BioGrid Australia provides authorised researchers with access to health records data after an application process so patient privacy and intellectual property are protected.  BioGrid Australia's approved researchers are provided access to multiple institutional databases,via the BioGrid interface, preventing gaps in patient records and research analysis.

Title#info: BioGRID | Database of Protein and Genetic Interactions
Authority: Princeton University, Universitï¿½ de Montrï¿½al, University of Edinburgh, Mount Sinai Hospital
Subjects: Genetics, Protein-protein interactions, Biology, Gene mapping, Organisms, Statistics
Description:
The Biological General Repository for Interaction Datasets
(BioGRID) is a curated protein-protein and genetic interaction repository with data compiled through comprehensive curation efforts. The current index searches 33,858 publications for 527,569 raw protein and genetic interactions from major model organism species.
#name: BioGRID | Database of Protein and Genetic Interactions

Title#info: Biologic Specimen and Data Repository Information Coordinating Center (BioLINCC)
Authority: The National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
Subjects: Epidemiology, Medicine, Diseases, Health, Biological specimens, Heart, Lungs, Blood, Biology, Cells, Clinical medicine
Description: This repository serves to coordinate searches across data and biospecimen collections and to provide an electronic means for requests for additional information and the submission of requests for collections. Some datasets are presented with studies and supporting materials to facilitate their use in reuse and teaching. Datasets support basic research, clinical studies, observational studies, and demonstrations.
#name: Biologic Specimen and Data Repository Information Coordinating Center (BioLINCC)

Authority: University of Wisconsin
Subjects: Nucleic acids, Proteins, Peptides, Metabolites, Macromolecules, Spectrum analysis, Magnetic resonance, Biology, Thermodynamics, Kinematics, Diseases, Histochemistry, Molecular biology, Molecules
Description: The Biological Magnetic Resonance Data Bank (BioMagResBank, or BMRB) collects, annotates, archives, and disseminates important spectral and quantitative data derived from NMR spectroscopic investigations of biological macromolecules and metabolites. BMRB is a depository of NMR results from peptides, proteins, and nucleic acids recognized by the International Society of Magnetic Resonance and by the IUPAC-IUBMB-IUPAB Inter-Union Task Group on the Standardization of Data Bases of Protein and Nucleic Acid Structures Determined by NMR Spectroscopy.

Authority: Centre for Ecology and Hydrology, NERC
Subjects: Zoology, Field recordings, Ecology, Biodiversity, Hydrology, Environmental chemistry--Research, Biology, Environmental health
Description: The Biological Records Centre (BRC) is a national focus in the UK for terrestrial and freshwater species recording. BRC works closely with the voluntary recording community, principally through support of national recording schemes and societies. It provides an application, iRecord, for people to use to record and submit their own wildlife observations to the repository. It also maintains schemes for a variety of wildlife surveys, atlases, publications, and other resources.

Authority: National Institute of General Medicine Sciences (NIGMS), National Institutes of Health [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Electrophysiology, Neurobiology, Biomedical materials, Imaging systems in biology, Medicine, Biology, Biomedical engineering, Brain, Health
Description: BIRN is a national initiative to advance biomedical research through data sharing and online collaboration. It supports multi-site, and/or multi-institutional, teams by enabling researchers to share significant quantities of data across geographic distance and/or incompatible computing systems.  BIRN offers a library of data-sharing software tools specific to biomedical research, best practice references, expert advice and other resources.
Reuse: Open to groups within the biomedical research community, see http://www.birncommunity.org/working-with-birn/faq/ for details and contact info.

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK]
Subjects: Systems biology, Biology--Mathematical models, Biological models, Biology, Molecular biology, Nucleotide sequence, Gene expression, Proteins, Genes, DNA, RNA, Genetics
Description: BioModels Database is a  repository of peer-reviewed, published, computational models that allows biologists to store, search and retrieve published mathematical models from the field of systems biology, but also more generally those of biological interest. Models in the database can be used to generate sub-models, can be simulated online, and can be converted between different representational formats.
Reuse: Open - See FAQ for details http://www.ebi.ac.uk/biomodels-main/faq

Title#info: bioSearch: Marine Biodiversity Database of India
Authority: National Insititute of Oceanography (NIO)
Subjects: Marine biodiversity, Biotechnology, Pollution, Pollution control equipment, Oceanography, Taxonomists, Biology, Habitat (Ecology), Organisms, Ecology, Environmental health, Biodiversity, Ecosystem health
Description: bioSearch is a web application developed to search and manage marine biodiversity data from Indian waters. It contains nearly 20,000 organism records that can be searched by keyword, scientific or common name, taxonomy, and habitat.
#name: bioSearch: Marine Biodiversity Database of India

Authority: University of Oxford, UK
Subjects: Biology, Life sciences, Databases, Ontology, Classification, Data archives, Genetics, Gene expression
Description: BioSharing is a catalog of bioscience reporting standards (minimum reporting guidelines, exchange formats and terminologies) and organizations that develop these. It also aims to link to policies, other portals, open access resources and lists of databases implementing the standards; develop and maintain a set of criteria for assessing the usability and popularity of the standards, also the interoperability and relations among them; foster interoperability, addressing overlaps and duplication of efforts that hamper their wider uptake and interfere with the creation of standards-compliant systems. BioSharing contains an extensive list of online databases in life sciences.

Authority: Academic contributors to the BDWD are listed at http://www.sel.barc.usda.gov/Diptera/names/BDWDpeop.htm
Subjects: Flies, Diptera, Biology, Insects, Gnats, Taxonomists, Biodiversity, Pollinators, Entomology
Description: The BioSystematic Database of World Diptera (BDWD) provides a comprehensive portal to knowledge about these dipterans as well as a framework to organize and integrate current and future data, information and knowledge.  BDWD includes a set of tools to aid users in finding information about flies, midges, gnats, bots, and other two-winged insects . The two main components of the BDWD are the Nomenclator and the Species database.

Authority: Geeknet, Inc.
Subjects: Physics, Chemistry
Description: The Blue Obelisk Data Repository lists many important chemoinformatics data such as element and isotope properties, atomic radii, etc. including references to original literature. Developers can use this repository to make their software interoperable.

Authority: Michigan State University
Subjects: Brain, Biodiversity
Description: The Brain Biodiversity Bank is a repository of images of and information about brain specimens contained in the collections associated with the National Museum of Health and Medicine at the Armed Forces Institute of Pathology in Washington, DC. These collections include, besides the Michigan State University Collection, the Welker Collection from the University of Wisconsin, the Yakovlev-Haleem Collection from Harvard University, the Meyer Collection from the Johns Hopkins University, and the Huber-Crosby and Crosby-Lauer Collections from the University of Michigan.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: ANP
Subjects: Petroleum, Geological mapping, Geophysical surveys, Geochemical modeling, Basins (Geology), Oil wells, Natural gas, Hydrocarbons, Seismic arrays, Geology
Description: Founded in May 2000, the BDEP stores, organizes and makes available geophysical, geological and geochemical information. The database, after processing and analysis, provides help to the areas of sedimentary basins where there's more probability of oil and natural gas. The data acquisition and management of this collection guarantees Brazil to the domain about the potential of knowledge generated in hydrocarbons.

Authority: BRC, Biological Records Centre, National Biodiversity Network, NBN, Natural Environment Research Council,  Centre for Ecology & Hydrology, CEH, Joint Nature Conservation Committee, JNCC
Subjects: Zoology, Biology
Description: The Biological Records Centre (BRC), established in 1964, is a national focus in the UK for terrestrial and freshwater species recording. BRC works closely with the voluntary recording community, principally through support of national recording schemes and societies. It provides an application, IRecord, for people to use to record and submit their own wildlife observations to the repository. Map and access datasets via the NBN Gateway, an Internet based data delivery service.

Authority: Westmead Millennium Institute
Subjects: Medicine, Health, Breast, Cancer, Tissue banks, Oncology
Description: The Breast Cancer Tissue Bank (BCTB) provides data contributed by an Australian network of cancer clinicians, researchers, and patients.  BCTB privacy protection policy ensures patients' identities are not revealed and cancer researchers are the only individuals with open access to data.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit (Private submissions welcome)

Authority: Natural Environment Research Council [Wallingford, Oxfordshire, UK]
Subjects: Geospatial data, Biosphere, Earth sciences, Cryosphere, Plants, Fossils, Atmosphere, Physical sciences, Geography, Oceanography, Geology, Hydrology, Geological mapping, Archaeology
Description: British Antarctic Survey (BAS) has, for over 60 years, undertaken the majority of Britain's scientific research on and around the Antarctic continent. Atmospheric, biosphere, cryosphere, geosphere, hydrosphere, and Sun-Earth interactions metadata and data are available. Geographic information and collections are highlighted as well. Information and mapping services include a Discovery Metadata System, Data Access System, the Antarctic Digital Database, a fossil database, and the Antarctic Plant Database.
Reuse: Open. Prior written permission required for commercial use - http://www.antarctica.ac.uk/site/copyright.php. Requests for third party data will be referred to the original data provider.
Deposit: All data collected by UK funded scientists in the Antarctic and Southern Ocean must be submitted to a recognised Data Centre to ensure appropriate long term curation - http://www.antarctica.ac.uk/bas_research/data/submission.php

Authority: British Atmospheric Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council [Oxfordshire, UK]
Subjects: Atmosphere, Climatic changes, Weather, Atmosphere--Data processing, Geological surveys, Earth sciences, Ecology, Hydrology, Stratosphere, Ozone, Meteorology, Meteorological instruments, Clouds, Water vapor, Atmospheric, Climatic changes, Meteorological satellites, Radiation
Description: The British Atmospheric Data Centre (BADC) is the Natural Environment Research Council's (NERC) Designated Data Centre for the Atmospheric Sciences. The role of the BADC is to assist UK atmospheric researchers to locate, access and interpret atmospheric data and to ensure the long-term integrity of atmospheric data produced by NERC projects.
Deposit: Must have a BADC account - http://badc.nerc.ac.uk/data/submit.html for details

Authority: Natural Environment Research Council [Wallingford, Oxfordshire, UK]
Subjects: Fossils, Minerals, Rocks, Geology, Physical sciences, Earth sciences, Geological surveys, Geological mapping, Geophysics, Groundwater, Ecology, Soil chemistry, Natural disasters, Borehole mining
Description: The British Geological Survey (BGS), the worldâs oldest national geological survey, has over 400 datasets including environmental monitoring data, digital databases, physical collections (borehole core, rocks, minerals and fossils), records and archives.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council [Liverpool, UK]
Subjects: Geophysical surveys, Marine ecology, Ocean, Oceanography, Biology, Earth sciences, Geophysics, Marine biology, Marine biodiversity, Biodiversity, Ocean circulation
Description: BODC holds wealth of publicly accessible marine data collected using a variety of instruments and samplers and collated from many sources. They handle biological, chemical, physical and geophysical data and their databanks contain measurements of nearly 22,000 different oceanographic variables.

Authority: University of Georgia, Warnell School of Forestry and Natural Resources, UGA Warnell, University of Georgia, College of Agricultural and Environmental Sciences, Department of Entomology, UGA College of Agricultural and Environmental Sciences, Department of Entomology, United States Department of Agriculture, Forest Service , USDA Forest Service, US Forest Service, United States Department of Agriculture, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Plant Protection and Quarantine Program, PPQ, United States Department of Agriculture, National Institute of Food and Agriculture , CSREES, NIFA
Subjects: Biology
Description: Host website for the WeedUS database and EDDMapS as well as Forestry Images and Bark Beetles. Formerly 'Bugwood Network', the centre aims to develop, consolidate and disseminate information and programmes focused on invasive species, forest health, natural reource and agricultural management through technology development, programmes implementation, training, applied research and public awareness at state, regional, national and international levels. The site gives details of its products (Bugwood Image Database; Early Detection and Distribution Mapping and Bugwoodwiki). Details of its projects, services and personnel are provided. Users can also access image libraries for Forestry, Insects, IPM, Invasive Species, Forest Pests and Bark Beetle.

Authority: National Cancer Institute
Subjects: Cancer, Life sciences, Gene expression
Description: caArray is an open-source, web accessible array data management system specializing in microarray/gene expression. caArray uses a federated model of local installations whose results are shareable across the cancer Biomedical Informatics Grid (caBIGâ¢). caArray furthers translational cancer research through acquisition, dissemination and aggregation of semantically interoperable array data to support subsequent analysis by tools and services on and off the Grid. A caArray application is hosted by the National Cancer Institute.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit. Submitted data will go through strict curation and an automatic validation process.

Title#info: CAIDA Data (The Cooperative Association for Internet Data Analysis)
Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, Cooperative Association for Internet Data Analysis, CAIDA, University of California at San Diego, Supercomputer Center, UC, SDSC, Defense Advanced Research Project Agency, DARPA, Homeland Security, Department of Homeland Security, ARIN, American Registry of Internet Numbers, CISCO
Description: The Cooperative Association for Internet Data Analysis (CAIDA) is a collaborative undertaking among organizations in the commercial, government, and research sectors aimed at promoting greater cooperation in the engineering and maintenance of a robust, scalable global Internet infrastructure.It is an independent analysis and research group with particular focus on: Collection, curation, analysis, visualization, dissemination of sets of the best available Internet data, providing macroscopic insight into the behavior of Internet infrastructure worldwide,    improving the integrity of the field of Internet science, improving the integrity of operational Internet measurement and management, informing science, technology, and communications public policies.
#name: CAIDA Data (The Cooperative Association for Internet Data Analysis)

Authority: Mosquito and Vector Control Association of California, MVCAC, California Department of Public Health, CDPH, University of California, Center for Vectorborne Diseases , CVEC
Subjects: Medicine
Description: CalSurv is a comprehensive information on West Nile virus, plague, malaria, Lyme disease, trench fever and other vectorborne diseases in California ï¿½ where they are, where theyï¿½ve been, where they may be headed and what new diseases may be emerging.The CalSurv Web site serves as a portal or a single interface to all surveillance-related Web sites in California.

Authority: Microsoft Research, University of California, Berkeley Water Center Data Server, BWC
Description: Through the Microsoft eScience Project, the Berkeley Water Center is developing a Water Cyberinfrastructure prototype that can be used to investigate and eventually manage water resources. The Water Cyberinfrastructure is developing in close collaboration between IT, physical science, and California water agency leaders. The value of the Cyberinfrastructure prototype will be tested through relevant end-to-end demonstration focused on important California Basins. The study region(s) are chosen based on several criteria, including availability of the data, importance of the problem that can be tackled given the cyberinfrastructure to California, leveraging opportunity, and scientific importance of the problems to be addressed. The BWC is currently building partnerships with several water representatives, such as the USGS, Sonoma County Water Agency, the Monterey County Water Resource Agency, and the NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service. Our objective with the California Water projects is to first assemble only the most critical components needed to address relevant science questions, rather than to initially create fully developed problem solving environments or construct a grand scale solution.

Authority: Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre
Subjects: Metals, Nucleic acids, Lipids, Fat, Proteins, Carbohydrates, Crystallography, Pharmaceutical biotechnology
Description: The principal product of the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre (CCDC), the Cambridge Structural Database (CSD), records bibliographic, chemical, and crystallographic information for organic molecules and metal-organic compounds whose 3D structures were determined using either X-ray diffraction or neutron diffraction. CSD provides database access, structure visualization and data analysis, and structural knowledge bases.

Title#info: Canada National Climate Data and Information Archive
Authority: Environment Canada
Subjects: Rain and rainfall, Almanacs, Climatology, Weather
Description: The National Climate Data and Information Archive of Canada includes datasets related to historical climate data, almanac data, climate normals, averages, and summaries, and rainfall intensity-duration-frequency statistics.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Canada National Climate Data and Information Archive

Title#info: Canada's Michael Smith Genome Sciences Centre
Authority: BC Cancer Research Centre
Subjects: Cancer, DNA, Bioinformatics, Genomics, Proteomics, High throughput screening (Drug development), Gene expression
Description: The Genome Sciences Centre (GSC) creates and serves scientific databases, data assets, and data services. Data includes: C. elegans gene expression, the Mouse Atlas of Gene Expression, ORegAnno, cisRED, Follicular Lymphoma Genome Data, ChIP-Seq, ALEXA, and physical mapping data.
Deposit: Membership in BC Cancer Research Centre
#name: Canada's Michael Smith Genome Sciences Centre

Title#info: Canada-Nova Scotia Offshore Petroleum Board (CNSOPB) Data Management Centre
Authority: CNSOPB
Subjects: Earth sciences, Land degradation--Control, Environmental health, Health, Petroleum, Nova Scotia
Description: The DMC is designed to provide registered users with access to non-confidential petroleum exploration and production data from offshore Nova Scotia, subject to certain conditions. The DMC is housed in the CNSOPB's Geoscience Research Centre located in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia.
#name: Canada-Nova Scotia Offshore Petroleum Board (CNSOPB) Data Management Centre

Authority: Universitï¿½ de Montrï¿½al
Subjects: Biodiversity, Entomology, Botany, Mycology, Taxonomists
Description: Canadensys, a DataCite Canada member, accepts organism occurrence data from museums, departments, institutions, and individuals. Data are made available to other international projects (e.g., GBIF), are searchable via an Explorer, http://data.canadensys.net/explorer/search, and authors are encouraged to dedicate their data to the Public Domain.

Authority: Canadian Space Agency, National Research Council Canada
Subjects: Galaxies, Astrophysics, Sky, Atmosphere, Astronomy, Stars, Planets
Description: The CADC provides access to data from several sources, including the CFHT Legacy Survey, the CFHT MegaCam Stacks, the Canadian Virtual Observatory Services, the Hubble Legacy Archive, the Solar System Object Search, BLAST, CGPS, DAO, FUSE, Gemini, HST, MACHO, MOST, AstroCat, and the Digitized Sky Survey.
Access: Free registration required to retrieve original, archival data

Authority: Government of Canada
Subjects: Sustainability, Ecosystem health, Conservation biology, Ocean, Fisheries, Environmental sciences, Natural resources, Biology, Biodiversity
Description: The CBIF provides primary data on biological species of interest to Canadians. CBIF supports a wide range of social and economic decisions including efforts to conserve our biodiversity in healthy ecosystems, use our biological resources in sustainable ways, and monitor and control pests and diseases. Tools provided by the CBIF include the Integrated Taxonomic Information System (ITIS), Species Access Canada, Online Mapping, and the SpeciesBank, including Butterflies of Canada. The CBIF is a member of the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF).
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Cybera, Inc.
Subjects: Solar system, Ionosphere, Geospatial data, Geomagnetism, Space sciences
Description: The CSSDP enables and simplifies space science researcher access to a wide range of space data, observations, and investigative tools by providing a single point of access to these resources through a custom web portal. This collection and presentation of space data is used to study the influence of the sun on near-Earth space environment, including phenomena such as geomagnetic storms. CSSDP integrates data from sources such as the Canadian Geospace Monitoring Program and ORBITALS (Outer Radiation Belt Injection, Transport, Acceleration and Loss Satellite).
Deposit: Closed. Annotation of data is possible.

Authority: National Cancer Institute
Subjects: Nanotechnology, Cancer, Biomedical engineering, Life sciences
Description: The caNanoLab portal is a web-based application designed to facilitate data sharing in the biomedical nanotechnology research community to expediate and validate the use of nanotechnology in biomedicine. caNanoLab provides access to information on nanotechnology protocols in biomedicine, composition of nanomaterials, physico-chemical characterizations, in vitro characterizations, and publications and reports from nanotechnology studies in biomedicine.

Authority: University of Helsinki
Subjects: Life sciences, Cancer, Genomes, Tumors, Genes, Bioinformatics
Description: CanGEM is a public, web-based database for storing clinical information about tumor samples and microarray data, as well as relevant metadata for measurements and samples. CanGEM's emphasis is on array comparative genomic hybridization (aCGH) and data mining of gene copy number changes.

Title#info: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, The (CDIAC)
Authority: U.S. Department of Energy
Subjects: Solar radiation, Fossil fuels, Climatology, Carbon dioxide, Carbon cycle (Biogeochemistry), Atmospheric carbon dioxide, Atmospheric radiation, Sea level--Environmental aspects, Ecosystem health
Description: The CDIAC is the primary climate-change data and information analysis center of the U.S. Department of Energy, and includes the World Data Center for Atmospheric Trace Gases. CDIAC's data holdings include records of the atmospheric concentrations of carbon dioxide and other radiatively active gases; the role of the terrestrial biosphere and the oceans in the biogeochemical cycles of greenhouse gases; emissions of carbon dioxide from fossil-fuel consumption and land-use changes; long-term climate trends; the effects of elevated carbon dioxide on vegetation; and the vulnerability of coastal areas to rising sea level. CDIAC provides data management support for major projects, including the AmeriFlux Network; continuous observations of ecosystem level exchanges of CO2, water, energy and momentum at different time scales for sites in the Americas; the Ocean CO2 Data Program of CO2 measurements taken aboard ocean research vessels; DOE-supported FACE experiments, which evaluate plant and ecosystem response to elevated CO2 concentrations; and NARSTO, which assesses ozone and fine particle processes in the troposphere over North America. CDIAC is supported by DOE's Climate Change Research Division of the Office of Biological and Environmental Research.
Reuse: Open with suggested citations, see: http://cdiac.ornl.gov/permission.html
#name: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, The (CDIAC)

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK]
Subjects: Enzymes, Proteins, Amino acids, Catalysis, Activation (Chemistry)
Description: EBI's CSA contains data documenting enzyme active sites and catalytic residues in enzymes of 3D structure. Entries in CSA may be original hand-annotated entries from primary literature or homologous entries found by PSI-BLAST alignment.

Authority: Istituto Juan March de Estudios e Investigaciones, Center for Advanced Study in the Social Sciences, Fundacion Juan March, Istituto Juan March
Subjects: Jurisprudence, Economics, Social sciences, Psychology
Description:
The CEACS Data Library aims to support its research community to conduct quantitative research with primary and secondary data of the highest quality. The Data Library provides integrated access to an extensive collection of data for research and teaching. This collection comprises studies from major data centres as well as public collections and other datasets of special interest to members of CEACS.
This section offers the possibility to search and browse the collection. The links go to records on the catalogue or the data directly on our servers or the web. If you cannot locate or access the data you are after please contact the Data Librarian for further assistance.

Authority: National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research, University of California, San Diego
Subjects: Cells, Microscopy, Tomography
Description: The Cell Centered Database (CCDB) project was started in 1998 to provide a venue for sharing and mining cellular and subcellular data. The CCDB project provides access to primary and derived imaging 2D, 3D, and 4D data from light and electron microscopy. Researchers can query and download datasets derived from high-resolution light microscopy and electron tomography.

Authority: United States Department of Agriculture - National Agricultural Statistics Service (USDA-NASS)
Subjects: Agriculture--Statistics, Agriculture
Description: The Census of Agriculture provides extensive data about U.S. agriculture at the country, state and county level.  The census is conducted every 5 years, and it gathers uniform, detailed data about U.S. farms and ranches and their operators.  Data from recent censuses are available in different formats, but historical censuses (back to 1840) are available in pdf format.

Title#info: Center for Demography of Health and Aging (CDHA)
Authority: University of Wisconsin
Subjects: Population aging, Middle age, Aging, Evaluation research (Social action programs)
Description: The CDHA assists researchers to create, document, and distribute public use microdata on health and aging for secondary analysis.  Major research themes include: midlife development and aging; economics of population aging; inequalities in health and aging; international comparative studies of health and aging; and the investigation of linkages between social-demographic and biomedical research in population aging.  The CDHA is one of fourteen demography centers on aging sponsored by the National Institute on Aging.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Center for Demography of Health and Aging (CDHA)

Title#info: Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)
Authority: The Earth Institute, Columbia University
Subjects: Remote sensing, Poverty, Population, Land cover, Land use, Environmental health, Environmental impact analysis, Economics, Biotic communities, Biodiversity, Agriculture, Earth sciences
Description: The CIESIN provides access to information that helps people understand the relationship between human beings and the environment. CIESIN works at the intersection of the social, natural, and information sciences, and specializes in on-line data and information management, spatial data integration and training, and interdisciplinary research related to human interactions in the environment.
