The Portal aggregates and presents data from research institutions, government bodies, NGOs, universities, the mass media, and experts across various issues of environmental management.
Type: Institutional (supported by the Govt.) and Disciplinary

Authority: The Arghyam Foundation
Subjects: Sanitation, India, Water, Hygiene, Rural health, Urban sanitation, Rural population--Attitudes, Human rights, Disasters--Environmental aspects, Disasters--Environmental aspects, Disasters--Health aspects
Description: India Sanitation Portal (ISP) is an open, inclusive, web-based platform for sharing sanitation knowledge among practitioners and the general public. The Portal seeks to address the knowledge asymmetry by sharing best practices, advocating sustainable approaches, bringing transparency of public data and information, and by spreading awareness. The Portal is a collaborative efforts of several organisations, charitable and commercial, that try to provide clear and practical knowledge to the public.

Authority: The Arghyam Foundation
Subjects: Water quality, Watershed hydrology, Rain and rainfall, Irrigation, Hydrology, Drinking water--Analysis, Sanitation, Water and civilization, Groundwater, Groundwater ecology
Description: The India Water Portal is web-based platform for sharing water management knowledge in India amongst practitioners and the general public. It includes approximately 200 datasets that can be browsed by data type, location, time, and other metadata. Data include rainfall, watersheds, groundwater, water quality, and irrigation.

Authority: Indian Institute of Chemical Biology
Subjects: Genetic disorders, India
Description:
Indian Genetic Disease Database (IGDD) is an initiative of CSIR Indian Institute of Chemical Biology. It is supported by Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR) and Department of Biotechnology (DBT) of India. 
The Indian people represent one-sixth of the world population and consists of a ethnically, geographically, and genetically diverse population. In some communities the ratio of genetic disorder is relatively high due to consanguineous marriage practiced in the community. This database has been created to keep track of mutations in the causal genes for genetic diseases common in India and help the physicians, geneticists, and other professionals retrieve and use the information for the benefit of the public. The database includes scientific information about these genetic diseases and disabilities, but also statistical information about these diseases in today's society. Data is categorized by body part affected and then by title of the disease.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit from registered users

Authority: Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO)
Subjects: Astrophysics, Astronomy, Satellite launching ships, Astronautics, Space
Description: Indian Space Science Programme has the primary goal of promoting and establishing space science and technology programme. The ISSDC is the primary data center to be retrieved from Indian space science missions. This center is responsible for the collections of payload data and related ancillary data for space science missions such as Chandrayaan, Astrosat, Youthsat, etc. The payload data sets can include a range of information including satellite images, X-ray spectrometer readings, and other astrological observations.

Authority: International Society of Systemic Auto-Inflammatory Diseases (ISSAID)
Subjects: Biology, Genetics, DNA, RNA, Proteins, Diseases, Mutation (Biology), Heredity, Bioinformatics, Inflammation
Description: Infevers is a registry of hereditary auto-inflammatory diseases.  Infevers requires membership to access their data.  Data is provided in tabular lists, gene graphs, descriptive statistics, and genomic sequences. Affiliated with the Human Genome Variation Society.

Authority: National Institute of Informatics
Subjects: Consumer behavior--Data processing, Research institutes--Archival resources, Information display systems, Information science
Description: The Informatics Research Data Repository is a Japanese data repository that collects data on disciplines within informatics. Such sub-categories are things like consumerism and information diffusion. The primary data within these data sets is from experiments run by IDR on how one group is linked to another.
Access: Application is required. Some need contracts.
Reuse: Terms of use are explained for each data set. http://www.nii.ac.jp/cscenter/idr/en/datalist.html

Authority: Institute of Geology & Mineral Exploration, EKBAA-IGME, Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland, Earthquake Planning and Protection Organisation, EPPO, Foundation for Research and Technology - Hellas, Institute of Computer Science, FORTH, ICS, National Research Council , CNR, European Commission, EU, Competitiveness and Innovation Framework Programme (CIP), CIP, European Commission, Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community, INSPIRE
Description: InGeoCloudS is to demonstrate the possibilities in using cloud computing for a common infrastructure for geodata. Cloud computing provides access to almost unlimited resources for data storage and calculations at large data centres. The project will demonstrate the possibilities for using the cloud for common basic data and for sharing in - telligent services which can combine data and e.g. deliver themes for managing Europe's natural resources and environment.

Authority: Simon Fraser University, University of British Columbia, Teagasc Animal Bioscience Department
Subjects: Immune response, Genes, Proteins, Immunity, Biology, Mammals
Description: InnateDB was developed to facilitate systems level investigations of the mammalian (human, mouse and bovine) innate immune response. The database provides a manually-curated knowledgebase of the genes, proteins, and interactions and signaling responses involved in mammalian innate immunity.

Authority: FIZ Karlsruhe
Subjects: Crystallography, Chemistry, Chemistry, Inorganic, Chemical elements
Description: The Inorganic Crystal Structure Database (ICSD) contains a list of more than 150,000 known inorganic crystal structures published since 1913, including their atomic coordinates. In particular, the database provides information on: structural data of pure elements, minerals, metals, and intermetallic compounds, structural descriptors, bibliographic data, and synthesis conditions. All crystal structures contained in the database have been evaluated and checked for quality by an editorial team. ICSD is updated twice a year, each time adding approximately 3,500 new records.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Universitï¿½ libre de Bruxelles (ULB)
Subjects: Astronomy, Astrophysics, Physics, Stellar activity, Stellar dynamics, Nuclear reactions, Nuclear astrophysics, Stellar granulation, Astrodynamics
Description: The IAA at the UniversitÃ© libre de Bruxelles maintains data collections such as Nuclear Database (BRUSLIB), Nuclear Network Generator NetGen, NACRE II, the Ninth Catalogue of Orbits of Spectroscopic Binaries, the Henize sample and radial-velocity monitoring of barium and S stars, and stellar models (pre-main-sequence and super-AGB phases).
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Harvard University
Subjects: Social sciences, Infrastructure (Economics)--Econometric models, Efficient market theory--Mathematical models, Social participation
Description: IQSS is a university-wide institute devoted to the preservation and analysis of the data sets on the social sciences. IQSS directs large, interdisciplinary research projects; build infrastructure that facilitates the research of students, faculty and others; house research groups and technology centers; and administer professional staff and IT tools that increase the productivity of others.

Title#info: Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS) Data Sets
Authority: Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS)
Subjects: Public libraries, Museums, Public libraries--Administration, Public services (Libraries)
Description: The IMLS conducts annual surveys of public and state libraries in the US that have response rates near 100%. Data is compiled for states, library systems, and individual library branches and includes statistics for circulation, visits, staff, expenditures, and more. Data is available in two formats: MS Access and flat file, plain text. Data for museums is forthcoming.
#name: Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS) Data Sets

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK]
Subjects: Cyanobacteria, Protein binding, Chromatin, Cancer, Apoptosis, Molecular biology, Bioinformatics
Description: IntAct is a molecular interaction database from the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI). The database is open source analysis tools for molecular interaction data are provided. All interactions are derived from literature curation or direct user submissions.

Authority: ICDC
Description: The CliSAP-Integrated Climate Data Center (ICDC) allows easy access to climate relevant data from in-situ measurements and satellite remote sensing. These data are important to determine the status and the changes in the climate system. Additionally some relevant re-analysis data are included, which are modeled on the basis of observational data.

Authority: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
Subjects: Marine biology, Oceanography, Marine organisms, Deep sea corals, Deep-sea biology, Coral communities, Coral colonies
Description: NOAA's ICON is a central location for data related to coral reefs.  Data is integrated near-real time and recent. ICON also provides ecological forecasts provided through artificial intelligence technology as they relate to the occurrence of specified environmental conditions as prescribed by modelers, oceanographers, and marine biologists.

Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, University of Florida, Florida State University
Subjects: Biodiversity
Description: The National Resource for Advancing Digitization of Biodiversity Collections (ADBC) funded by the National Science Foundation. Through ADBC, data and images for millions of biological specimens are being made available in electronic format for the research community, government agencies, students, educators, and the general public.
Deposit: Accepting in scope data for deposit

Authority: Population Studies Center, Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR), University of Michigan
Subjects: Surveys, Fertility, Families, Sociology, Population, Demography, Gender identity, Behavioral assessment, Family planning, Family, Fertility, Mortality, Reproductive health--Social aspects, Pregnancy
Description: The Integrated Fertility Survey Series (IFSS) is a project of the Population Studies aiming in view to produce a harmonized dataset of U.S. family and fertility surveys spanning five decades (1955-2002). IFSS integrates data from ten underlying component studies of family and fertility encompassing the Growth of American Families (GAF) in 1955 and 1960; National Fertility Surveys (NFS) in 1965 and 1970; as well as National Surveys of Family Growth (NSFG) in 1973, 1976, 1982, 1988, 1995, and 2002. The first release contains harmonized sociodemographic variables for all respondents from all ten component studies, including those related to marital status, race and ethnicity, etc. Thus it provides access to researchers, educators, students, policy makers, and others with a data resource to examine issues related to families and fertility in the United States. Potential users can download original/ harmonized datasets (along with documentation) and numerous analytic tools make it possible to quickly and easily explore the data and obtain information about changes in behaviors and attitudes across time.
Deposit: Closed (responsible organization and credential individuals of member institutions)

Title#info: Integrated Ocean Drilling Programm (IODP) (Exploring the earth under the sea)
Authority: U.S. National Science Foundation, NSF, Integrated Ocean Drilling Program, Management International, IODP-MI, United States Implementing Organization, USIO, Center for Deep Earth Exploration, CDEX, IODP-coordination office Hannover, Japan's Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology, MEXT, The European Consortium for Ocean Research Drilling, ECORD, The People's Republic of China Ministry of Science and Technology, MOST, Korea Institute of Geology, Mining and Materials, KIGAM, Australian-New Zealand IODP Consortium, ANZIC, India Ministry of Earth Science, MoES, Coordination for Improvement of Higher Education Personnel, CAPES
Description:
The Integrated Ocean Drilling Program (IODP) is an international marine research program that explores Earth's history and structure recorded in seafloor sediments and rocks, and monitors subseafloor environments. IODP builds upon the earlier successes of the Deep Sea Drilling Project (DSDP) and Ocean Drilling Program (ODP), which revolutionized our view of Earth history and global processes through ocean basin exploration. IODP greatly expands the reach of these previous programs by using multiple drilling platforms, including riser, riserless, and mission-specific, to achieve its scientific goals.
IODP maintains an integrated data and publications portal, the Scientific Earth Drilling Information System (SEDIS) , which serves as a one-stop-shop for discovery, searching and accessing data. The main data contributors to SEDIS currently are the IODP implementing organizations (IOs) from the United States (USIO), Japan (CDEX) and Europe with Canada (ESO).
Deposit: restricted: registration; Submitting proposals - http://www.iodp.org/submitting-proposals; Guidelines - http://www.iodp.org/guidelines; Drilling Proposals - http://www.iodp.org/drilling-proposals
#name: Integrated Ocean Drilling Programm (IODP) (Exploring the earth under the sea)

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK], The Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics [Lausanne, Switzerland]
Subjects: Test anxiety, Ligases, Isomerases, Lyases, Hydrolases, Transferases, Oxidoreductases, Biochemistry, Molecular biology, Enzymes, Bioinformatics
Description: IntEz contains the recommendation of the Nomenclature Committee of the International Union of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology on the nomenclature and classification of enzyme-catalyzed reactions. Users can browse by enzyme classification or use advanced search options to search enzymes by class, subclass and sub-subclass information.

Authority: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
Subjects: Ocean, Fisheries, Biology, Chemistry, Meteorology, Oceanography, Oceanographic buoys, Water temperature
Description: Integrated Science Data Management (ISDM) manages and archives ocean data collected by the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO), or acquired through national and international programs conducted in ocean areas adjacent to Canada.
Reuse: Open. For personal and public non-commercial use only. http://www.meds-sdmm.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/notice-avis/2010/04-08-2010-eng.asp
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Title#info: Inter-University Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR)
Authority: ICPSR, Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan [Ann Arbor, MI]
Subjects: Political science, Demography, Economics, History, Gerontology, Public health, Terrorism, Psychology
Description: ICPSR provides leadership and training in data access, curation, and methods of analysis for a diverse and expanding social science research community. ICPSR maintains a data archive of more than 500,000 files of research in the social sciences. Disciplines represented include political science, sociology, demography, economics, history, gerontology, criminal justice, public health, foreign policy, terrorism, health and medical care, early education, education, racial and ethnic minorities, psychology, law, substance abuse and mental health, and more.
#name: Inter-University Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR)

Title#info: International Arctic Systems for Observing the Atmosphere (IASOA) Data Portal
Authority: International Polar Year (IPY)
Subjects: Meteorology, Greenhouse gases, Pollutants, Chemistry, Aerosols, Surface energy, Atmospheric radiation, Clouds, Arctic Regions
Description: International Arctic Systems for Observing the Atmosphere (IASOA) provides and collects multi-year continuous data on atmospheric conditions in the Arctic. International Polar Year (IPY) maintains partnerships with Arctic observatories from Sweden, Canada, United States, Russia, Norway, Finland, and Greenland. Each IASOA observatory features extensive suites of co-located, research grade active, passive and in-situ observing systems.  Atmospheric characteristics of interest are standard meteorology, greenhouse gases, atmospheric radiation, clouds, pollutants, chemistry, aerosols, and surface energy balances.  IASOA operates within boundaries defined by (1) the Arctic (2) the atmosphere (3) the ground-based vantage point (4) data generated by instrument systems and (5) multi-year continuous records to support climate studies.
#name: International Arctic Systems for Observing the Atmosphere (IASOA) Data Portal

Authority: World Health Organization (WHO)
Subjects: Diseases, Disease susceptibility, Mortality, Epidemiology, Health, Chronic diseases, Communicable diseases, Hemorrhagic diseases, Symptoms, Syndromes, Genetic disorders, Constitutional diseases, Membrane disorders
Description: ICD serves as the international standard for diagnostic classification for all general epidemiological, many health management purposes and clinical use. The ICD's resources include the analysis of different population groups' general health situations, monitoring of the incidence and prevalence of diseases in relation to the characteristics of the individuals affected, reimbursement, resource allocation, quality, and guidelines. The records provide the basis for the compilation of national mortality and morbidity statistics, and enable the storage and retrieval of diagnostic information for clinical epidemiological and quality purposes.

Title#info: International Council for Science World Data System (ICSU WDS)
Authority: International Council for Science (ICSU)
Subjects: Statistics, Marine sciences, Seismology, Computer science, Mathematics, Land use, Biology, Geography, Chemistry, Physics, Space sciences, Earth sciences, Life sciences
Description: The International Council for Science World Data System (ICSU WDS) is a prototype data portal for retrieving data from WDS members. ICSU WDS' retrieval systems is  based on members metadata records which facilitate discovery and exchange. The metadata catalog can be searched by data description or other data characteristics, geographic coordinates, or time the data was submitted/created.
#name: International Council for Science World Data System (ICSU WDS)

Title#info: International Data Service Center of the Institute for the Study of Labor (IDSC IZA)
Subjects: Social sciences
Description:
IDSC is IZA's organizational unit whose purpose is to serve the scientific and infrastructural computing needs of IZA and its affiliated communities.
IDSC is dedicated to supporting all users of data from the novice researcher to the experienced data analyst.
IDSC aims at becoming the place for economically minded technologists and technologically savvy economists looking for data support, data access support and data services about labor economics.
IDSC is actively involved in organizing events (see our next Red Cube Seminar Talk) for data professionals, data analysts, and scientific data users and young researchers to discuss and share findings and to establish contacts for future cooperation.
#name: International Data Service Center of the Institute for the Study of Labor (IDSC IZA)

Title#info: International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS)
Authority: Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy, International Astronomical Union, IAU, International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics, IUGG
Description: The IERS provides data on Earth orientation, on the International Celestial Reference System/Frame, on the International Terrestrial Reference System/Frame, and on geophysical fluids. It maintains also Conventions containing models, constants and standards.
#name: International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS)

Authority: International Food Policy Research Institute [Washington, DC]
Subjects: Globalization, Molecular biology, Sustainable agriculture, Bioenergetics, Climate and civilization, Poverty, Nutrition, Agriculture
Description: The International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI) is involved in the collection and analysis of sustainable agriculture data in collaboration with institutions worldwide. Data is gathered on local, national and international levels to provide datasets on poverty, finance, agriculture and food for education programs. Users can use keyword searching as well as guided search options to access the datasets or browse datasets by date. Access to publications and multiple reference tools is available through the IFPRI Library and Knowledge Management Unit. IFPRI is one of 15 centers supported by the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research.

Subjects: Biodiversity, Forests and forestry
Description: The IFRI research network examines how governance arrangements affect forests and the people who depend on them. It is comprised of 14 Collaborating Research Centers located around the globe. Researchers use a common data collection method to ensure that sites can be compared across space and time. The IFRI database contains information about biodiversity, livelihoods, institutions, and forest carbon for over 250 sites in 15 countries between 1992 and the present.

Authority: International Long Term Ecological Research, ILTER
Description: ILTER is a 'network of networks', a global network of research sites located in a wide array of ecosystems that can help understand environmental change across the globe. ILTER's focus is on long-term, site-based research and monitoring.

Authority: National Institutes of Health, NIH, The Jackson Laboratory, JAX, Mouse Genome Informatics, MGI, National Library of Medicine, NLM
Subjects: Medicine, Medicine
Description:
The IMSR is a searchable online database of mouse strains, stocks, and mutant ES cell lines available worldwide, including inbred, mutant, and genetically engineered strains. The goal of the IMSR is to assist the international scientific community in locating and obtaining mouse resources for research. Note that the data content found in the IMSR is as supplied by strain repository holders.
For each strain or cell line listed in the IMSR, users can obtain information about:
Where that resource is available (Repository Site); What state(s) the resource is available as (e.g. live, cryopreserved embryo or germplasm, ES cells); Links to descriptive information about a strain or ES cell line; Links to mutant alleles carried by a strain or ES cell line; Links for ordering a strain or ES cell line from a Repository; Links for contacting the Repository to send a query

Authority: National R + D + i of the Ministry of Economy and Competitiveness
Subjects: Microbiology, Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, Animal scientists, Space sciences, Crystallography, Amino acids, Molecular biology
Description: ODiSEA is an inventory of research data sets that pertain to the general sciences. Before a data set is entered into the catalog it is groomed for content validity and research grade information. Each entry in the inventory is a data repository created by and for research institutions.

Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Cloud forecasting, Meteorology, Cloud physics, Hydrologic cycle, Radiation, Hydrology, Clouds, Climatology
Description: The International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) is a database of intended for researchers to share information about cloud radiative properties. The data sets focus on the effects of clouds on the climate, the radiation budget, and the long-term hydrologic cycle. Within the data sets the data entries are broken down into entries of specific characteristics based on temporal resolution, spatial resolution, or temporal coverage.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: National Space Weather Center, Korean Space Weather Center, KSWC
Description: The International Space Environment Service (ISES) is a collaborative network of space weather service-providing organizations around the globe. Our mission is to improve, to coordinate, and to deliver operational space weather services. ISES is organized and operated for the benefit of the international space weather user community.

Title#info: International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astrometry of NASA (IVS)
Authority: Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy, National Aeronautics and Space Agency, NASA, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Haystack Observatory , MIT , Vienna University of Technology, Department of Geodesy and Geoinformation, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, Crustal Dynamics Data Information System, CDDIS, Paris Observatory
Description: IVS is an international collaboration of organizations which operate or support Very Long Baseline Interferometry (VLB I) components. The service aspect of IVS is meant to serve both outside users and the geodetic and astrometric community itself. Both the contributors and users of data will be served.
#name: International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astrometry of NASA (IVS)

Authority: Internet Archive
Subjects: Audio-visual archives, Web archives, Software documentation
Description: The Internet Archive includes texts, audio, moving images, software, and archived web pages.
Deposit: Open to public-domain material, or where rights are cleared

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK]
Subjects: Proteins, Nucleic acids, Genomes, Amino acids, Amino acid sequence
Description: InterPro collects information about protein sequence analysis and classification, providing access to a database of predictive protein signatures used for the classification and automatic annotation of proteins and genomes. Sequences in InterPro are classified at superfamily, family, and subfamily. InterPro predicts the occurrence of functional domains, repeats, and important sites, and adds in-depth annotation such as GO terms to the protein signatures.

Authority: Purdue University
Subjects: Plants, Botany, Nature and nurture, Yeast fungi, Yeast--Research, Brassica, Corn--Research, Arabidopsis, Rice--Research, Arabidopsis thaliana--Research, Soybean--Research
Description: iHUB is a collaborative environment that supports research that relate to the genes and gene networks that control the ionomes, mineral nutrient, and trace element compositions of tissues and organisms. It provides tools to share data, literature, and coordinating collection efforts, among others. It contains ionomic data on more than 200,000 samples.

Title#info: IPB MassBank (IPB MS Database) (High resolution mass spectral database) (JST-BIRD MassBank)
Authority: Leibniz Institute for Plant Biochemistry, Institute for Bioinformatics Research and Development, BIRD
Subjects: Mass spectrometry
Description: The IPB is operating the first european MassBank site, that is part of the consortial MassBank Project. You can access both the set of IPB Tandem-MS and Ion Trap spectra, as well as the other massbank sites.
Deposit: restricted: registration; Preparation of MassBank records - http://www.massbank.jp/manuals/Part4_DataPreparation_en.pdf
#name: IPB MassBank (IPB MS Database) (High resolution mass spectral database) (JST-BIRD MassBank)

Title#info: IPUMS-I (Integrated Public Use Microdata Series - International)
Authority: Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota248
Subjects: Household surveys, Census, Demography, Ethnicity, Education, Work, Income, Dwellings, Fertility
Description: IPUMS is the world's largest accessible collection of individual-level data on population, and is a collaboration of over 100 national statistical agencies.
Reuse: freely available for re-use; requires free account
#name: IPUMS-I (Integrated Public Use Microdata Series - International)

Title#info: IQSS Dataverse network (IQSS DVN) (Harvard Dataverse Network)
Authority: Harvard University, Institute for Quantitative Social Sciences, IQSS
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: The Harvard Dataverse Network is open to all scientific data from all disciplines worldwide. It includes the world's largest collection of social science research data. It is hosting data for projects and archives.
Deposit: restricted: registration; Study and Data Administration - http://guides.thedata.org/book/study-options
#name: IQSS Dataverse network (IQSS DVN) (Harvard Dataverse Network)

Authority: International Research Insitute for Climate and Society and the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, Columbia University
Subjects: Hydrology, Fisheries, Weather, Topoclimatology, Oceanography, Atmosphere, Climatology, Environmental sciences, Global Weather Experiment Project, Climate change mitigation
Description: The IRI/LDEO Climate Data Library is a collection of climate data sets with the focus of climate change monitoring and mitigation. Browse data by category and source, navigate and analyze datasets using maps, and the Ingrid Data Analysis Language. The IRI/LDEO also includes web tutorials.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: University College Dublin, UCD Dublin, Department of Public Expenditure and Reform, Department of Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation, Higher Education Authority, HEA
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: The Irish Social Science Data Archive (ISSDA) is Irelandï¿½s leading centre for quantitative data acquisition, preservation, and dissemination. Its mission is to ensure wide access to quantitative datasets in the social sciences, and to advance the promotion of international comparative studies of the Irish economy and Irish society.

Authority: National Park Service,  U.S. Department of the Interior
Subjects: Geographic information systems, Water, Geospatial data, Environmental sciences, Air quality, Culture, Biology, Climatology
Description: IRMA (Integrated Resource Management Applications) provides natural and cultural resources data from the National Park Service. Most entries are in the form of peer-reviewed publications, but some are raw data sets based on in-park research projects.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: NASA, California Institute of Technology, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
Subjects: Wavelengths, Cosmic background radiation, Artificial satellites, Astronomy, Sky, Space, Scientific satellites, Galaxies, Galaxies--Evolution, Galaxies--Formation, Stars, Circumstellar matter
Description: A part of the Infrared Processing and Anlysis Center, the NASA/IPAC Infrared Science Archive exists to curate the callibrated science products and data from NASA's infrared and sub-millimeter missions. It provides access to archives from the Spitzer Space Telescope, the 2MASS(Two Micron All Sky Survey), the IRAS, and the datasets compiled from multiple missions, such as COSMOS.

Authority: Yale University
Subjects: Social sciences, Economics, Political science, Political science literature, Political ethics, Bioethics, Bioethics--Law and legislation
Description: The ISPS is a Yale based institution that was created to assist in the sharing of research grade information pertaining to the social and economic sciences. The majority of digital content in the ISPS Data Archive currently consists of social science research data from experiments, program files with the code for analyzing the data, requisite documentation to use and understand the data, and associated files.

Title#info: ISRIC World Soil Information  (International Soil Reference and Information Centre)
Authority: ISRIC World Soil Information, Managing Board
Subjects: Soil science, Land use, Water use, Food security, Climate change mitigation, Land cover, Agriculture
Description: ISRIC provides soil datasets and maps on the local, national and global scale. A wider range of datasets can be queried using ISRIC's metadata service. In 2013 ISRIC opens a crowd souring framework for soil data storage.  ISRIC invites individuals and organizations collecting soil data to contribute their data to this world soil database.
Access: OpenâAccess for research and educational use
#name: ISRIC World Soil Information  (International Soil Reference and Information Centre)

Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, Indiana University, Biology Department, Genome Informatics Lab, Indiana University, IU, FlyBase
Subjects: Biology
Description: IUBio Archive is an archive of biology data and software.  The archive includes items to browse, search and fetch public software, molecular data, biology news and documents.

Title#info: IUCN Red List of Threatened Species
Authority: IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature)
Subjects: Endangered species, Mammals, Amphibians, Corals, Reptiles, Birds, Cichlids, Butterflies, Parrotfishes, Groupers, Wrasses, Mangrove plants, Seagrasses, Geographic information systems, Taxonomists, Population, Extinction (Biology), Spatial data infrastructures
Description: The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species provides taxonomic, conservation status and distribution data on plants and animals that are critically endangered, endangered and vulnerable.  Data are available in Esri File Geodatabase format, Esri Shapefile format, and Excel format.
#name: IUCN Red List of Threatened Species

Authority: University of Pennsylvania, J. Craig Venter Institute, JCVI, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease, NIAID, Virginia Bioinformatics Institute
Subjects: Plant genetics
Description: JCVI is a world leader in genomic research.

Authority: Japan Space Systems
Subjects: Space sciences, Operating systems (Computers), Observation (Scientific method), Space (Architecture)--Research
Description: Japan Space Systems (J-spacesystems) aims to contribute to the advancement of Japanese industry, space systems technology, conservation of the earth environment, utilization of the space environment, and other research and development efforts. The system provides access to data from unmanned space missions and remote sensing instruments.

Authority: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, WHOI, Keck Foundation
Description:
Jason is a remote-controlled deep-diving vessel that gives shipboard scientists immediate, real-time access to the sea floor. Instead of making short, expensive dives in a submarine, scientists can stay on deck and guide Jason as deep as 6,500 meters (4 miles) to explore for days on end.
Jason is a type of remotely operated vehicle (ROV), a free-swimming vessel connected by a long fiberoptic tether to its research ship. The 10-km (6 mile) tether delivers power and instructions to Jason and fetches data from it.

Authority: Albin Sandelin (University of Copenhagen), Boris Lenhard (University of Bergen)
Subjects: Transcription factors, DNA, Bioinformatics, Molecular biology, Eukaryotic cells, Biology
Description: JASPAR is a collection of smaller databases of transcription factor DNA-binding preferences. The JASPAR CORE database contains a curated, non-redundant set of profiles, derived from published collections of experimentally defined transcription factor binding sites for eukaryotes.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Hyogo University of Teacher Education, Teaching Materials and Culture Museum
Description: JEDI is an educational data archive service that collects, preserves, and distributes empirical data for academic, educational and governmental administrative purposes.
Deposit: restricted: registration; JEDI Collection Development Policy - http://essrc.hyogo-u.ac.jp/en/policy/collection

Title#info: Journal of Applied Econometrics Data Archive
Authority: Department of Economics, Queen's University, Kingston, Ontario
Subjects: Econometrics, Econometric models--Computer programs, Econometric models, Econometrics--Study and teaching, Econometrics--Statistical methods, Econometrics--Methodology, Econometrics--Mathematical models
Description:
The JAE Data Archive, which is hosted by a server belonging to the Economics Department of Queen's University, contains data for all papers accepted after January, 1994, unless the data are confidential. There are also data for a few papers accepted earlier. Volume 10, No. 1 (1995) is the first issue in which all papers were accepted subject to the proviso that data be provided. 
For some papers, especially more recent ones, the Data Archive also contains programs and supplementary material, such as technical appendices and additional graphs. 

The Journal of Applied Econometrics takes no responsibility for the accuracy of any data, computer programs, or other material provided by authors and posted on this website. 

It is hoped that more authors of papers published prior to 1995 will voluntarily submit their data. If you are looking for data from a particular paper, and it is not here, please contact the authors directly and suggest that they send their data to the Data Archive.
#name: Journal of Applied Econometrics Data Archive

Authority: The Journal of Cell Biology, Rockefeller University Press
Subjects: Biochemistry, Cell cycle, Cell culture, Developmental biology, Developmental cytology, Embryology, Histology, Microscopy, Microscopes, Molecular biology, Imaging systems in medicine, Imaging systems in biology, Neurobiology, Resolution (Optics), Ultrastructure (Biology), Biology
Description: The JCB DataViewer is an image hosting and presentation platform for original image datasets associated with articles published in The Journal of Cell Biology, a peer-reviewed journal from the Rockefeller University Press.
Deposit: Authors of articles published in The Journal of Cell Biology: http://jcb-dataviewer.rupress.org/jcb/page/faq/

Authority: NASA, California Institute of Technology, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
Subjects: Climatology, Spectroradiometer, Clouds, Atmospheric aerosols
Description: The Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR) measurements are designed to improve understanding of the Earthâs environment and climate. MISR provides radiometrically and geometrically calibrated images in four spectral bands at each of nine widely-spaced angles. Spatial sampling of 275 and 1100 meters is provided on a global basis. All MISR data products are available in HDF-EOS format, and select products are available in netCDF format.
Access: Open. Account required for some data.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: NASA, California Institute of Technology, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
Subjects: Ocean, Remote sensing, Ocean temperature, Information visualization
Description: The OurOcean Portal enables users to access ocean science data, run data assimilation models, and visualize both data and models. Both real-time and retrospective analysis of remote sensing data and ocean model simulations in the Pacific Ocean are provided. The portal includes access to real-time Regional Ocean Modeling Systems (ROMS), the Global 1-km Sea Surface Temperature (G1SST) data set, and the Central & Northern California Ocean Observing System (CeNCOOS).
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Title#info: Karlsruhe Astrophysical Database of Nucleosynthesis in Stars (KADONIS)
Authority: Iris Dillmann [Justus Liebig University, Giessen], Tamï¿½s Szï¿½cs [Institute of nuclear research]
Subjects: Astrophysics, Isotopes--Analysis, Nucleosynthesis
Description: KADONIS is a database of theoretical cross sections of isotope distribution in stars. The  focus is on cross-sections relevant to the S-Process and P-Process, which create elements heavier than iron. The database is searchable by isotope and each isotope datasheet includes a full description of its maxwellian averaged cross section (MACS) at 30keV, and a table containing brief descriptions of its MACS at different energies.
#name: Karlsruhe Astrophysical Database of Nucleosynthesis in Stars (KADONIS)

Title#info: KASCADE Cosmic Ray Data Centre (KCDC) (Karlsruhe Shower Core and Array Detector)
Authority: Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Institute for Nuclear Physics
Description: The aim of the project KCDC (KASCADE Cosmic Ray Data Centre) is the installation and establishment of a public data centre for high-energy astroparticle physics based on the data of the KASCADE experiment. KASCADE was a very successful large detector array which recorded data during more than 20 years on site of the KIT-Campus North, Karlsruhe, Germany (formerly Forschungszentrum, Karlsruhe) at 49,1ï¿½N, 8,4ï¿½O; 110m a.s.l. KASCADE collected within its lifetime more than 1.7 billion events of which some 425.000.000 survived all quality cuts. Initially about 160 million events are available here for public usage.
#name: KASCADE Cosmic Ray Data Centre (KCDC) (Karlsruhe Shower Core and Array Detector)

Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), W. M. Keck Observatory (WMKO)
Subjects: Extrasolar planets, Space sciences, Spectrum analysis, Planets, Stars
Description: The Keck Observatory Archive (KOA) is a NASA-funded collaboration between the NASA Exoplanet Science Institute (NExScI) and the W. M. Keck Observatory (WMKO). The archive includes data from the High Resolution Echelle Spectrograph (HIRES) and the Near InfraRed echelle SPECtrograph (NIRSPEC).
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Kenya Open Data Project
Subjects: Economic history, Expenditures, Public, Statistics, Demography, Economic development, Political science, Kenya
Description: Kenya Open Data offers visualizations tools, data downloads, and easy access for software developers. Kenya Open Data provides core government development, demographic, statistical and expenditure data available for researchers, policymakers, developers and the general public. As of 2011, there were 390 datasets that have been uploaded to the site, along with 17,000 page views and over 2,500 dataset downloaded and embedded to various websites and portals.

Authority: Khazar University, Library and Information Center, LIC
Subjects: Life sciences
Description: The Khazar University Institutional Repository (KUIR), a suite of services offered by the Library Information Center, is an institutional repository  maintained to support the university's researchers, collaborators, and students. Repository content consists of collections of research materials in digital format produced and selected by Khazar University faculty and their collaborators.

Authority: Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute
Description: The KNMI Climate Explorer is a web application to analysis climate data statistically.

Authority: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS), Texas Tech University (TTU), Long Term Ecological Research (LTER), San Diego Supercomputer Center (SDSC)
Subjects: Biology, Evolution (Biology), Environmental sciences, Biodiversity, Entomology, Botany, Ecology, Biocomplexity, Life sciences
Description: The Knowledge Network for Biocomplexity (KNB) is a national network intended to facilitate ecological and environmental research on biocomplexity. For scientists, the KNB is an efficient way to discover, access, interpret, integrate and analyze complex ecological data from a highly-distributed set of field stations, laboratories, research sites, and individual researchers. You must create an account and login to search all data, which can be browsed by a variety of facets including habitat, taxonomy, level of organization, measurements, ecology, and evolution. KNB also maintains the Morpho software, which can register its datasets with the KNB.

Authority: FIZ Karlsruhe ï¿½ Leibniz Institute for Information Infrastructure
Subjects: Physics, Chemistry
Description:
More than 25 years ago FIZ Karlsruhe started depositing crystal structure data linked to publications in German journals. At that time it was irrelevant whether the deposited structures were organic or inorganic. Today FIZ Karlsruhe is responsible for storing the structure data of inorganic compounds. Organic structure data are stored by the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Center.
Nowadays many publishers inform their authors that in parallel to a publication in a scientific journal, crystal structure data should also be stored in the Crystal Structure Depot at FIZ Karlsruhe. A CSD number will be assigned to the data for later reference in the publication. The data can then be ordered from the Crystal Structure Depot at FIZ Karlsruhe.

Authority: University Library in Torun
Subjects: History
Description: The KPDL covers cultural heritage, scientific and regional collections ï¿½ digital copies of different forms of publications: books, journals, graphics, articles, leaflets, posters, playbills, photographs, invitations, maps, exhibition catalogues and trade fairs of the region. The Kujawsko-Pomorska Digital Library is to serve scientists, students, schoolchildren and all the citizens of the region.

Title#info: LAADS Web (Level 1 and Atmosphere Archive and Distribution System)
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Atmosphere, Satellites--Orbits, Remote sensing
Description: LAADS Web (Level 1 and Atmosphere Archive and Distribution System) provides data from MODIS and VIIRS satellites which orbit earth collecting atmospheric and land data.  Data are publicly available, but registration is required and some data must be ordered then delivered via FTP.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: LAADS Web (Level 1 and Atmosphere Archive and Distribution System)

Title#info: Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC)
Authority: United States Geological Survey (USGS)
Subjects: Vegetation and climate, Land cover
Description: The Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) is a component of NASAs Earth Observing System (EOS) Data and Information System (EOSDIS). LP DAAC processes, archives, and distributes land data and products derived from from three EOS instruments aboard two operational satellite platforms: ASTER and MODIS from Terra, and MODIS from Aqua.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC)

Title#info: Land Resource Information Systems Portal (LRIS Portal)
Authority: Landcare Research Ltd
Subjects: Land use, Land cover, Vegetation mapping, Soils and climate, Ecosystem services, Lithosphere, Climatology, Soil mapping, Soil surveys, Biodiversity, Geospatial data, Environmental sciences
Description: The LRIS Portal gives individuals working in regional and central government, industry, research and education quick and easy access to environment data held by Landcare Research. These geospatial datasets, many of which are of national significance, can be used for creating maps, analysis, modelling and research about New Zealandâs environments and land resources.
Reuse: Open; Creative Commons or Landcare Data Use Licence
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Land Resource Information Systems Portal (LRIS Portal)

Description:
As cultural competence center for the region, the Landesarchiv serves as the repository for records of cultural and historical value and assures the access of archives in Baden-Wuerttemberg as part of the cultural heritage. It identifies, collects, and preserves state records and makes them available to all those who are interested in historical records.
The Landesarchiv houses archival collections ranging from deeds from the Middle Ages to digital sources of our time (databases, e-mails, internet pages). The Landesarchiv has already been providing diversified access to archival collections via internet and is actively working on research and presentation of the history of Southwest Germany.
The archival collections of the Landesarchiv convey the cultural and historical diversity in Southwest Germany. Each holding is unique and characterizes the distinctive history of the people and the region.
This makes the Landesarchiv an irreplaceable reservoir of knowledge and experience with remarkable quantitative dimensions: The Landesarchiv houses about 146 shelf kilometers of documents and books, 310 thousand charters as well as 350 thousand maps and plans completed with photographs and audio-visual records. Electronic data are stored in the digital stack of the Landesarchiv.

Title#info: LAUDATIO (Long-term Access and Usage of Deeply Annotated Information)
Authority: CMS, National Institute for Research in Computer Science and Control, German Research Foundation
Subjects: Linguistics
Description: LAUDATIO aims to build an open access research data repository for historical linguistic data with respect to the above mentioned requirements of historical corpus linguistics. For the access and (re-)use of historical linguistic data the LAUDATIO repository uses a flexible and appropriate documentation schema with a subset of TEI customized by TEI ODD. The extensive metadata schema contains information about the preparation and checking methods applied to the data, tools, formats and annotation guidelines used in the project, as well as bibliographic metadata, and information on the research context (e.g. the research project). To provide complex and comprehensive search in the linguistic annotation data, the linguistic search and visualization tool ANNIS will be integrated in the LAUDATIO repository infrastructure.
#name: LAUDATIO (Long-term Access and Usage of Deeply Annotated Information)

Authority: Canonical
Subjects: Computer science
Description:
Launchpad is a software collaboration platform that provides: Bug tracking, Code hosting using Bazaar, Code reviews
      Ubuntu package building and hosting, Translations, Mailing lists, Answer tracking and FAQs, Specification tracking. Launchpad can host your projectï¿½s source code using the Bazaar version control system
Deposit: restricted: registration; Personal Package Archive Terms of Use - https://help.launchpad.net/PPATermsofUse

Title#info: Legacy Archive for Microwave Background Data Analysis (LAMBDA)
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Space sciences, Cosmic background radiation
Description: The Legacy Archive for Microwave Background Data Analysis (LAMBDA) is a multi-mission NASA center of expertise for cosmic microwave background radiation research. The purpose of LAMBDA is to develop and maintain data archives, offer scientific expertise on NASA missions, and to educate the general public.
Reuse: Open- http://lambda.gsfc.nasa.gov/contact/index.cfm. Information about Data set IDs: http://lambda.gsfc.nasa.gov/product/
#name: Legacy Archive for Microwave Background Data Analysis (LAMBDA)

Authority: Kaunas University of Technology, Policy and Public Administration Institute, Vilnius University, Institute for Social Research, Republic of Lithuania Ministry of Education and Science
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: LiDA provides virtual digital infrastructure where researchers can deposit, search, browse, make online analyses and download almost 300 quantitative and qualitative social sciences and humanities data sets.

Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Astronauts, Space flight, Space biology, Space medicine, Life sciences
Description: NASAâs Life Sciences Data Archive (LSDA) provides information and data from human, plant and animal subjects.  It is an active archive that provides data from 1961 (Mercury Project) through current flight and flight analog studies (International Space Station, Shuttle, bed rest studies, etc.).
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: European Bioinformatics Institute [Cambridge, UK]
Subjects: Bioinformatics, Nucleic acids, Proteins, Phylogeny
Description: The Ligand-Gated Ion Channel database provides access to information about transmembrane proteins that exist under different conformations, with three primary subfamilies: the cys-loop superfamily, the ATP gated channels superfamily, and the glutamate activated cationic channels superfamily.

Title#info: Limited Access Datasets From NIMH Clinical Trials
Authority: National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH)
Subjects: Depressed persons, Attention in children, Autism, Manic-depressive illness, Alzheimer's disease, Anxiety, Schizophrenia, Mental health care teams, Mental health, Clinical trials
Description: The data from NIMH-supported clinical trials are an important scientific resource. It is the view of NIMH that their full value can only be realized if they are made available, under appropriate terms and conditions, in a timely manner to the wider scientific community, provided that the confidentiality and privacy of study participants are protected.
Access: To assure that the confidentiality and privacy of study participants are protected, all investigators seeking access to data from NIMH-supported studies that are in the possession of the Institute must execute and submit as their request the appropriate standard Data Use Certification (DUC). Requesters must certify that their institution or organization is covered by a Federal Wide Assurance (FWA) issued by the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) Office of Human Research Protections. To assure tha
Deposit: Closed (NIMH studies only, no outside submissions)
#name: Limited Access Datasets From NIMH Clinical Trials

Title#info: LINDAT/CLARIN digital library (Centre for language research infrastructure in the Czech Republic)
Authority: Charles University, Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Institute of Formal and Applied Linguistics  , UFAL1258, CLARIN-ERIC, Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure - ERIC1260
Subjects: Linguistics, Humanities
Description:
LINDAT/CLARIN is designed as a Czech node of Clarin ERIC (Common Language
Resources and Technology Infrastructure). It also supports the goals of the META-NET language technology network. Both networks aim at collection, annotation, development and free sharing of language data and basic technologies between institutions and individuals both in science and in all types of research. The Clarin ERIC infrastructural project is more focused on humanities, while META-NET aims at the development of language technologies and applications. The data
stored in the repository are already being used in scientific publications in the Czech Republic.
#name: LINDAT/CLARIN digital library (Centre for language research infrastructure in the Czech Republic)

Title#info: LISS Panel (Longitudinal Internet Studies for the Social sciences)
Authority: Tilburg University, Instituut voor dataverzameling en onderzoek, CentERdata, Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research, NWO
Subjects: Social sciences
Description:
The LISS panel (Longitudinal Internet Studies for the Social sciences) is the principal component of the MESS project. It consists of 5000 households, comprising 8000 individuals. The panel is based on a true probability sample of households drawn from the population register by Statistics Netherlands. Households that could not otherwise participate are provided with a computer and Internet connection. A special immigrant panel is available in addition to the LISS panel. This immigrant panel is comprised of around 1600 households (2400 individuals) of which 1100 households (1700 individuals) are of non-Dutch origin.
Panel members complete online questionnaires every month of about 15 to 30 minutes in total. They are paid for each completed questionnaire. One member in the household provides the household data and updates this information at regular time intervals.
#name: LISS Panel (Longitudinal Internet Studies for the Social sciences)

Subjects: Economics, Social sciences
Description:
The Economics & Business Data Center (EBDC) is a combined platform for empirical research in business administration and economics of the Ludwigï¿½Maximilian University of Munich (LMU) and the Ifo Institute and aims at opening new fields for empirical research in business administration and economics.
In this regard, the EBDC provides innovative datasets of German companies, containing both survey data of the Ifo Institute as well as external balance sheet data. Therefore, the tasks of the EBDC also include the procurement and administration of data sources for research and teaching, the central provision, updating and documentation of external databases, as well as the acquisition of corresponding support tools.
Beyond that, the EBDC serves as a contact and central coordinator on licensing economic firm-level datasets for LMUï¿½s Munich School of Management and LMUï¿½s Department of Economics and supports researchers and guests of the LMU and the Ifo Institute on site. In the future, it will also conduct academic conferences on research with company data.

Title#info: Loeb Music Library (Digital Scores and Libretti Collection) (Eda Kuhn Loeb Music Library)
Authority: Harvard University Library,Office for Information Systems, OIS
Description: The scores and libretti in this Virtual Collection include first and early editions and manuscript copies of music from the eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries by J.S. Bach and Bach family members, Mozart, Schubert and other composers, as well as multiple versions of nineteenth century opera scores, seminal works of musical modernism, and music of the Second Viennese School. Many, such as variant editions of nineteenth century operas and related libretti, fall into intellectually related sets that are meant to be seen and used together. As a group, they give scholars a window into the study of historical performance practice that cannot be duplicated using the holdings of any one other library.
#name: Loeb Music Library (Digital Scores and Libretti Collection) (Eda Kuhn Loeb Music Library)

Title#info: LOGKOW (A databank of evaluated octanol-water partition coefficients (Log P)) (Log P)
Authority: Sangster Research Laboratories, Canadian National Committee for CODATA, CNC/CODATA
Subjects: Chemistry
Description: A databank of experimental data about partition coefficients, retrieved from the literature, on over 20.000 organic coumpounds (carbon numbers 1 - 130; gases, liquids and solids).
#name: LOGKOW (A databank of evaluated octanol-water partition coefficients (Log P)) (Log P)

Authority: Long Term Ecological Research Network-University of New Mexico [Albuquerque, NM]
Subjects: Wetlands, Lakes, Kelp bed ecology, Grasslands, Estuaries, Environmental sciences, Ecosystem management, Coastal ecology, Agriculture
Description: The Long Term Ecological Research (LTER) Network involves over 1800 scientists and researchers involved in investigating ecological processes over long temporal and broad spatial scales. The LTER Network promotes comparative research among related research programs within the United States and internationally. The LTER is supported by the National Science Foundation and contains 26 sites representing diverse ecosystem types and a broad range of environmental conditions. Users can browse or search data packages of collected information describing multiple biological species, processes and events such as animals, atmospheric properties, plants and organisms.

Title#info: Long Term Preservation at the Bavarian State Library-Library Archiving and Access System
Authority: BSB, LRZ
Subjects: History
#name: Long Term Preservation at the Bavarian State Library-Library Archiving and Access System

Authority: VU University Medical Centre, Department of Sociology, Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam, LASA, Ministry of Health Welfare and Sports, Directorate of Long-Term Care, Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: The Longitudinal Aging Study Amsterdam (LASA) at the VU University and VU University Medical Centre is initiated by the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports in 1991 to determine predictors and consequences of ageing. LASA focuses on, physical, emotional, cognitive and social functioning in late life, the connections between these aspects, and the changes that occur in the course of time

Authority: Cornell Lab of Ornithology
Subjects: Biodiversity, Sound, Birds, Animals, Sound recordings, Video recordings
Description: The Cornell Lab of Ornithologyâs Macaulay Library is an archive of bird and animal audio and video recordings from around the world. The recordings can be used for scientific research, education, and the arts.  Recordists are encouraged to contribute their data and recordings; workshops and informal training sessions are available. The library is self-described as the oldest, largest, and most comprehensive of its kind.

Authority: Center for Machine Learning and Intelligent Systems, UC-Irvine
Subjects: Algorithms--Data processing, Machine learning, Computer science
Description: The UCI Machine Learning Repository is a collection of databases, domain theories, and data generators that are used by the machine learning community for the empirical analysis of machine learning algorithms. It is used by students, educators, and researchers all over the world as a primary source of machine learning data sets. As an indication of the impact of the archive, it has been cited over 1000 times.

Authority: Iowa State University, National Corn Growers Association, United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Science Foundation (NSF)
Subjects: Corn, Genomics, Genomes, Genetics, Genotype-environment interaction, Phenotype, Gene mapping, Plant genome mapping, Plant genomes
Description: The Maize Genetics and Genomics Database focuses on collecting data related to the crop plant and model organism Zea mays. The project's goals are to synthesize, display, and provide access to maize genomics and genetics data, prioritizing mutant and phenotype data and tools, structural and genetic map sets, and gene models. MaizeGDB also aims to make the Maize Newsletter available, and provide support services to the community of maize researchers.

Title#info: Mansfeld's World Database of Agriculture and Horticultural Crops
Authority: Bundesministerium fï¿½r Bildung und Forschung, Leibniz Institute of Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research
Subjects: Plant breeding
Description: The Mansfeld's World Database of Agriculture and Horticultural Crops is an online database. As a contribution to the project "Federal Information System on Genetic Resources" (BIG, www.big-flora.de/). It reflects the contents of "Mansfeld's Encyclopedia of Agricultural and Horticultural Crops" (Hanelt and IPK 2001) and contains information on 6,100 crop plant species, excluding forestry and ornamental plants. Each species entry provides nomenclature and synonymy, common names in different languages, spontaneous distribution and regions of cultivation, uses, images, references, but also the ancestral species and notes on the phylogeny, variation and history.
#name: Mansfeld's World Database of Agriculture and Horticultural Crops

Authority: Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, Columbia University
Subjects: Ocean, Geology, Bathymetric maps, Topographic maps, Mid-ocean ridges, Submarine topography, Continental margins, Continental shelf, Continental slopes
Description: MGDS provides free access to data collected from the global oceans in the area of marine geoscience.  Primary data types served are multibeam bathymetric data from the ocean floor, seismic reflection data imaging below the seafloor, and multi-disciplinary ship based data from the Southern Ocean. Other holdings include deep-sea photographic transects, and ultra-high resolution bathymetry, temperature probe data, biological species compilations, MAPR and CTD data. Derived data products and sets include microseismicity catalogs, images, visualization scenes, magnetic and gravity compilations, grids of seismic layer thickness, velocity models, GIS project files, and 3D visualizations.
Deposit: Open; see http://www.marine-geo.org/contribute.php for more information

Authority: Bioinformatics Centre, National Institute of Oceanography
Subjects: Organisms, India, Marine organisms
Description: Marine Microbial Database of India is an initiative of CSIR National Institute of Oceanography (NIO). It is supported by Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR) and managed by Biodiversity Informatics Group (BIG), Bioinformatics Centre of the NIO. It contains records about 1,814 marine microbes. Each record provides information on microbeâs location, habitat, importance (of the organism), threats (to the organism). The database also provides a Taxonomic Hierarchy and Scientific Name Index.
Deposit: Accepting data from the internal users

Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, WHOI, Office of Naval Research, ONR, Massachusetts Technology Collaborative
Description: The Martha's Vineyard Coastal Observatory (MVCO) is a leading research and engineering facility operated by Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution. The observatory is located at South Beach and in the ocean a mile off the south shore of Martha's Vineyard where it provides real time and archived coastal oceanographic and meteorological data for researchers, students and the general public.

Authority: Space Telescope Science Institute-Association of Universities for research in Astronomy, Inc. [Baltimore, MD]
Subjects: Aeronautics, Space telescopes, Astronomy, Astronomical instruments
Description: MAST provides a variety of astronomical data archives with a focus on scientifically related data sets in the optical, ultraviolet and near-infrared portions of the spectrum. Users can access all MAST missions through the data interface, and cross-reference missions through use of the Cross Correlation search catalog to retrieve spectral and image data. MAST is a component of NASAâs distributed Space Science Data Services.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit from qualified researchers- http://archive.stsci.edu/guidelines.html

Authority: Institute of Biology and Chemistry of proteins
Subjects: Extracellular matrix proteins, Polysaccharides, Thrombospondins, Molecular biology, Proteins, Chemistry, Biology
Description: MatrixDB is a database focused on interactions established by extracellular proteins and polysaccharides. MatrixDB is an active member of the International Molecular Exchange (IMEx) consortium and has adopted the PSI-MI standards for annotating and exchanging interaction data.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: ICF International, US Agency for International Development (USAID)
Subjects: Surveys, Health, Fertility, HIV infections, AIDS (Disease), Education, Female circumcision, Anemia, Malaria, Demography, Immunization, Family planning, Contraception, Mortality, Nutrition, Anthropometry
Description: MEASURE DHS is advancing global understanding of health and population trends in developing countries through nationally-representative household surveys that provide data for a wide range of monitoring and impact evaluation indicators in the areas of population, health, HIV, and nutrition.  The database collects, analyzes, and disseminates data from more than 300 surveys in over 90 countries.   MEASURE DHS distributes, at no cost, survey data files for legitimate academic research.

Title#info: Measurements of Pollution In The Troposphere (MOPITT)
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), Canadian Space Agency
Subjects: Environmental sciences, Carbon monoxide, Troposphere, Pollution
Description: Measurements Of Pollution In The Troposphere (MOPITT) was launched into sun-synchronous polar orbit on December 18, 1999. MOPITT monitors changes in pollution patterns and the effects on Earthâs troposphere. MOPITT uses near-infrared radiation at 2.3 Âµm and thermal-infrared radiation at 4.7 Âµm to calculate atmospheric profiles of CO.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Measurements of Pollution In The Troposphere (MOPITT)

Title#info: Measures of Effective Teaching - Longitudinal Database (MET Longitudinal Database)
Authority: ICPSR, Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research, University of Michigan, U-M, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: The Measures of Effective Teaching(MET) project is the largest study of classroom teaching ever conducted in the United States. The University of Michigan compiled the MET data and video files into a rich research collection called the MET Longitudinal Database. Approved researchers can access the restricted MET quantitative and video data using secure online technical systems. The MET Longitudinal Database consists of a Web-based application for searching the collection and viewing the videos with accompanying metadata, and a Virtual Data Enclave that provides secure remote access to the quantitative data and documentation files.
#name: Measures of Effective Teaching - Longitudinal Database (MET Longitudinal Database)

Title#info: MedEffect Canada - Canada Vigilance Adverse Reaction Online Database
Authority: Health Canada
Subjects: Health products, Drugs, Pharmacology, Drug interactions
Description: MedEffect Canadaâs Canada Vigilance Adverse Reaction Online Database contains information about suspected adverse reactions to health products.
#name: MedEffect Canada - Canada Vigilance Adverse Reaction Online Database

Authority: Melanoma Molecular Map Project [Advisory Board- http://www.mmmp.org/MMMP/import.mmmp?page=sc_adv.mmmp]
Subjects: Melanoma, Cancer cells, Molecular biology
Description: MMMP databases are seven databanks dedicated to the collection of translational and clinical information on melanoma biology and treatment. The Project includes the Targeted Therapy Analyzer, Targeted Therapy Database, Biomaps, Biocards, Melanoma Molecular Profile, Drug Development Database and Clinical Trial Database as well as a glossary of terms and risk assessment tools. The databases rely heavily on information from PubMed, Medline, Embase, Cancerlit and Cochrane databases and their data is intended for research use and to generate hypothesis only.

Authority: California Digital Library, CDL, University of California Curation Center, UC3
Subjects: Life sciences
Description:
Merritt is a curation repository for the preservation of and
access to the digital research data of the ten campus University of California system and external project collaborators.
Merritt is supported by the University of California Curation Center (UC3) at the California Digital Library (CDL).
While Merritt itself is content agnostic, accepting digital content regardless of domain, format, or structure, it is being used for management of research data, and it forms the basis for a number of domain-specific repositories, such as the ONEShare repository for earth and environmental science and the DataShare repository for life sciences.
Merritt provides persistent identifiers, storage replication, fixity audit, complete version history, REST API, a comprehensive metadata catalog for discovery, ATOM-based syndication, and curatorially-defined collections, access control rules, and data use agreements (DUAs).
Merritt content upload and download may each be curatorially-designated as public or restricted.
Merritt DOIs are provided by UC3's EZID service, which is integrated with DataCite.
All DOIs and associated metadata are automatically registered with DataCite and are harvested by Ex Libris PRIMO and Thomson Reuters Data Citation Index (DCI) for high-level discovery.
Merritt is also a member node in the DataONE network; curatorially-designated data submitted to Merritt are automatically registered with DataONE for additional replication and federated discovery through the ONEMercury search/browse interface.
Reuse: restricted; other - Use guide; other - BSD License

Description: MetaCrop is a database that summarizes diverse information about metabolic pathways in crop plants and allows automatic export of information for the creation of detailed metabolic models.  MetaCrop is a database that contains manually curated, highly detailed information about metabolic pathways in crop plants, including location information, transport processes and reaction kinetics.

Authority: Argonne National Laboratory
Subjects: Genomics, Genomics--Data processing, Proteomics, RNA, Bioinformatics
Description: The MG-RAST server is an open source system for annotation and comparative analysis of metagenomes. Users can upload raw sequence data in fasta format; the sequences will be normalized and processed and summaries automatically generated. The server provides several methods to access the different data types, including phylogenetic and metabolic reconstructions, and the ability to compare the metabolism and annotations of one or more metagenomes and genomes. In addition, the server offers a comprehensive search capability. Access to the data is password protected, and all data generated by the automated pipeline is available for download in a variety of common formats. MG-RAST has become an unofficial repository for metagenomic data, providing a means to make your data public so that it is available for download and viewing of the analysis without registration, as well as a static link that you can use in publications. It also requires that you include experimental metadata about your sample when it is made public to increase the usefulness to the community.

Title#info: Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE)
Authority: University of Michigan
Subjects: Language and languages
Description: Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE) provides transcripts of academic speech events recorded at the University of Michigan. MICASE currently provides 152 transcripts.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE)

Authority: J. Craig Venter Institute
Subjects: Microbial proteins, Bacteria, Biology, Microbiology
Description: The Microbial Protein Interaction Database (MPIDB) provides physical microbial interactions. Over 24,000 experimentally determined interactions among proteins of 250 bacterial species/strains can be browsed and downloaded.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: The CUCKOO Workgroup, University of Science & Technology of China
Subjects: Biology, Cell cycle, Eukaryotic cells, Centrosomes, Proteins, Bioinformatics
Description: MiCroKit provides protein data identified as localized  kinetochore, centrosome, and/or midbody from two fungi (S. cerevisiae and S. pombe) and five animals, including C. elegans, D. melanogaster, X. laevis, M. musculus and H. sapiens.

Authority: University of Minnesota [Minneapolis, MN]
Subjects: Demography, Population geography, Health behavior, Education, Statistics
Description: The Minnesota Population Center (MPC) is an interdisciplinary cooperative for demographic research serving faculty and scientists at ten colleges and institutes through the University of Minnesota. Research is focused on the analysis of demographic behaviors with an empirical emphasis. Research is conducted on such subjects as labor-force studies, migration and immigration, healthcare access and use, life-course studies, and family demography; among others. Data is available from several MCP projects such as the North Atlantic Population Project & the American Time Use Survey-X.

Authority: University of Rome
Subjects: Protein-protein interactions, Bioinformatics, Proteins, Proteomics
Description: MINT, the Molecular INTeraction database, focuses on experimentally verified protein-protein interactions mined from the scientific literature by expert curators.

Title#info: MIRAGE (Middlesex medical Image Repository with a CBIR Archiving Environment) (MIRAGE 2011: Repository Enrichment from Archiving to Creation)
Authority: Middlesex University, Joint Information Systems Committee , JISC
Subjects: Medicine
Description: MIRAGE is developing a warehouse of medical images to facilitate effective online retrieval tools in the institutional web site to complement the existing online e-leaning and teaching system OASISplus, also known as Blackboard Vista , that is currently in operation at Middlesex University (MU)
Reuse: open; other - All collections are strictly used for education and research purposes
#name: MIRAGE (Middlesex medical Image Repository with a CBIR Archiving Environment) (MIRAGE 2011: Repository Enrichment from Archiving to Creation)

Authority: University of Manchester
Subjects: Biology, Genetics, RNA, Genomics
Description: miRBase provides published miRNA sequences and annotation. Each entry in the miRBase Sequence database represents a predicted hairpin portion of a miRNA transcript, with information on the location and sequence of the mature miRNA sequence (termed miR).

Authority: University of Rome "Tor Vergata", Italian Cancer Research Association
Description: MINT is a public repository for molecular interactions reported in peer-reviewed journals.IT is a collection of molecular interaction databases that can be used to search for, analyze and graphically display molecular interaction networks and pathways from a wide variety of species. MINT is comprised of separate database components. HomoMINT, is an inferred human protein interatction database. Domino, is database of domain peptide interactions. A new component has been added called VirusMINT that explores the interactions of viral proteins with human proteins.

Authority: National Chemical Laboratory, Digital Information Resource Center , NCL, DIRC
Subjects: Chemistry, Pharmacology, Pharmacy, Medicine
Description: MolTable: An Open Access (Molecule Table) Portal for "Advanced Chemoinformatics Research, Training and Services"

Authority: Florida State University, School of Computational Science
Subjects: Science, Biodiversity, Images, Photographic, Biological specimens, Biology, Herbaria, Botany, Entomology, Morphology, Phylogeny, Evolution (Biology)
Description: An NSF-supported repository of over 350,000 high-resolution photographs of approximately 4,000 species for research and education, used largely but not exclusively in the area of biodiversity research. Images can be annotated by users and browsed by specimen, view, taxonomy, location, collection, or annotation.
Reuse: open, default (and most restrictive) license is CC BY-NC-SA

Authority: MorphoBank Project; Stony Brook University
Subjects: Phylogeny, Cladistic analysis, Morphology, Anatomy, Evolution (Biology), Homology (Biology), Systems biology
Description: MorphoBank is a web application providing an online database and workspace for evolutionary research, specifically systematics (the science of determining the evolutionary relationships among species).
