MorphoBank enables researchers to upload images and affiliate data with those images (labels, species names, etc.) and allows researchers to upload morphological data and affiliate it with phylogenetic matrices. MorphoBank is project-based, meaning a team of researchers can create a project and share the images and associated data exclusively with each other. When a paper associated with the project is published, the research team can make their data permanently available for view on MorphoBank where it is now archived.

Authority: The Jackson Laboratory
Subjects: Genomes, Genetics, Genomics, Biology, Mice
Description: Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) is the international database resource for the laboratory mouse, providing integrated genetic, genomic, and biological data to facilitate the study of human health and disease. The projects contributing to this resource are: Mouse Genome Database (MGD) Project, Gene Expression Database (GXD) Project, Mouse Tumor Biology (MTB) Database Project, Gene Ontology (GO) Project at MGI, and MouseCyc Project at MGI.
Reuse: Open. Commercial use requires written permission: http://www.informatics.jax.org/mgihome/other/copyright.shtml

Authority: The Jackson Laboratory
Subjects: Biology, Gene expression, Phenotype, Mice as laboratory animals
Description: The Mouse Phenome Database (MPD) characterizes strains of laboratory mice for translational discoveries, and selection of mouse strains for experimental studies.
Deposit: Credentialed individuals in mouse phenotype research

Authority: Max Plank Insititute
Subjects: Animal behavior, Tracking and trailing
Description: Movebank is a free online infrastructure created to help researchers manage, share, analyze, and archive animal movement data. Movebank allows users to publish animal tracking datasets by uploading them to Movebank (www.movebank.org). Published datasets go through a submission and review process, and are typically associated with a written study published in an academic journal.
Deposit: Data owner, or someone given explicit permission by the data owner.

Authority: University of Cambridge
Subjects: Gene mapping, Gene expression, Genomes, Mosquitoes, RNA, Entomology
Description: MozAtlas provides gene expression data of adult male and female mosquitoes as tables, expressions, trees and models. MozAtlas also provides sequence orthology relationships with data provided by FlyBase, Vectorbase, Beetlebase, BeeBase, and WormBase.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Helmholtz Zentrum Mï¿½nchen German Research Center for Environmental Health (GmbH)
Subjects: Biology
Description: MPact is a repository of biological interactions. MPact provides an access point to interaction resources at the Munich Information Center for Protein Sequences (MIPS). It is designed to support the PSI-MI standard for downloading and uploading data.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Title#info: Multimodal Learning Corpus Exchange (MULCE) (Multimodal Learning and Teaching Corpora) (LETEC) (MUltimodal contextualized Learner Corpus Exchange)
Authority: University of Franche-Comtï¿½, Laboratoire d'informatique de Franche-Comtï¿½, French National Research Agency
Description:
Mulce (MUltimodal contextualized Learner Corpus Exchange) is a research project supported by the National Research Agency (ANR programme: "Corpus and Tools in the Humanities", ANR-06-CORP-006).
A teaching corpus (LETEC - Learning and Teaching Corpora) combines a systematic and structured data set, particularly of interactional data, and traces left by a training course experimentation, conducted partially or completely online and completed by additional technical, human, pedagogical and scientific information to enable the data to be analysed in context.
#name: Multimodal Learning Corpus Exchange (MULCE) (Multimodal Learning and Teaching Corpora) (LETEC) (MUltimodal contextualized Learner Corpus Exchange)

Authority: University of Waterloo
Subjects: Performing arts, Sheet music, Music
Description:
The Mutopia Project offers sheet music editions of classical music for free download. These are based on editions in the public domain, and include works by Bach, Beethoven, Chopin, Handel, Mozart, and many others. A team of volunteers are involved in typesetting the music by computer using the LilyPond software. 

A growing number of modern editions, arrangements and new music are also available for download. The respective editors, arrangers and composers have chosen to make these works freely available.

Authority: Oxford e-Research Centre, University of Oxford (on behalf of a consortium including University of Manchester and University of Southampton, UK)
Subjects: Bioinformatics, Workflow
Description: The myExperiment repository contains the largest public collection of scientific workflows for a variety of workflow systems and disciplines. Launched in November 2007, myExperiment supports Linked data, has a SPARQL Endpoint and REST API and is based on an open source Ruby on Rails codebase.

Authority: Monash University, eResearch Centre, University of Queensland, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, RMIT, University of Sydney, Australian Synchrotron, Swinburne University of Technology
Subjects: Medicine
Description:
MyTardis began at Monash University to solve the problem of users needing to store large datasets and share them with collaborators online. Its particular focus is on integration with scientific instruments, instrument facilities and research lab file storage. Our belief is that the less effort a researcher has to expend safely storing data, the more likely they are to do so.
This approach has flourished with MyTardis capturing data from areas such as protein crystallography, electron microscopy, medical imaging and proteomics and with deployments at Australian institutions such as University of Queensland, RMIT, University of Sydney and the Australian Synchrotron. The Australian Synchrotron deployment alone has captured over 20 terabytes and 10,000 datasets, archiving and providing data access and sharing tools to its community of thousands.

Authority: National Institutes of Health (NIH), Research Triangle Institute
Subjects: Nanotubes, Nanotechnology, Nanotubes, Nanostructures, Nanofibers, Nanoparticles, Materials
Description: The Nanomaterial Registry is a publicly available repository for curated research data on nanomaterials, including their physico-chemical characteristics and their interactions with biological and environmental systems.
Deposit: Deposition is done by submission to the curation team; support for data management plans

Authority: Atmospheric Science Data Center, NASA Langley Research Center [Langley, VA]
Subjects: Pollutants, Air quality management, Climatology, Air quality, North America, Aerosols, Tropospheric chemistry
Description:
NARSTO is dedicated to improving management of air quality in North America.  Additionally, NARSTO is working to improve collaboration between the air-quality and health-sciences research communities, to advance understanding of the scientific issues involved in effecting a multi-pollutant/multi-media approach to air quality management, and to increase understanding of the linkages between air quality and climate change.  NARSTO is represented by private and public organizations in Canada, Mexico, and the United States.

NARSTO was terminated as of December 31, 2010. While data remain available via the original NARSTO Data Archive, the permanent data archive is maintained by the NASA Langley Research Center Atmospheric Science Data Center at https://eosweb.larc.nasa.gov/project/narsto/narsto_table.

Title#info: NASA Clouds and Earth's Radiant Energy System Information and Data (CERES)
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Atmosphere, Clouds, Radiation--Measurement, Climatology, Solar radiation, Solar radiation--Forecasting, Meteorology, Climate change mitigation
Description: The Clouds and the Earthâs Radiant Energy System (CERES) is a key component of the Earth Observing System (EOS) program. CERES instruments provide radiometric measurements of the Earthâs atmosphere from three broadband channels. CERES products include both solar-reflected and Earth-emitted radiation from the top of the atmosphere to the Earth's surface.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: NASA Clouds and Earth's Radiant Energy System Information and Data (CERES)

Title#info: NASA Distributed Active Archive Center at National Snow & Ice Data Center  (NASA DAAC at NSIDC)
Authority: National Science foundation , NSF, National Snow and Ice Data Center , NSIDC, NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System , EOSDIS, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration , NOAA, University of Boulder, Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Sciences , CIRES
Subjects: Oceanography
Description:
The NSIDC Distributed Active Archive Center (DAAC) processes, archives, documents, and distributes data from NASA's past and current Earth Observing System (EOS) satellites and field measurement programs. The NSIDC DAAC focuses on the study of the cryosphere.
The NSIDC DAAC is one of NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) Data Centers.
Deposit: restricted: registration; How to submit your data - http://nsidc.org/data/submit.html
#name: NASA Distributed Active Archive Center at National Snow & Ice Data Center  (NASA DAAC at NSIDC)

Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Atmosphere, Environmental sciences, Earth sciences, Science, Aeronautics, Space
Description: The NASA Earth Exchange (NEX) represents a platform for the Earth science community that provides a mechanism for scientific collaboration and knowledge sharing. NEX combines supercomputing, Earth system modeling, workflow management, NASA remote sensing data feeds, and a knowledge sharing platform to deliver a complete work environment in which users can explore and analyze large datasets, run modeling codes, collaborate on new or existing projects, and quickly share results among the Earth Science communities. Includes some local data collections as well as links to data on other sites.

Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration, NASA, NASA Exoplanet Science Institute, NExSci, California Institute of Technology, Infrared Processing and Analysis Center, IPAC, California Institute of Technology, Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Exoplanet Exploration Program, EXEP
Description: The NASA Exoplanet Archive collects and serves public data to support the search for and characterization of extra-solar planets (exoplanets) and their host stars. The data include published light curves, images, spectra and parameters, and time-series data from surveys that aim to discover transiting exoplanets. Tools are provided to work with the data, particularly the display and analysis of transit data sets from Kepler and CoRoT. All data are validated by the Exoplanet Archive science staff and traced to their sources. The Exoplanet Archive is the U.S. data portal for the CoRoT mission.
Deposit: restricted: registration; How to Contribute Data to the NASA Exoplanet Archive - http://exoplanetarchive.ipac.caltech.edu/docs/contribute_data.html

Title#info: NASA/GEWEX Surface Radiation Budget (SRB) Data and Info
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
Subjects: Hydrologic cycle, Atmosphere, Radiation, Climatology, Meteorology, Ozone layer depletion, Radiation carcinogenesis--Prevention
Description: The Global Energy and Water Cycle Experiment (GEWEX) models the Earthâs water cycle. The NASA/GEWEX Surface Radiation Budget (SRB) data sets contain global 3-hourly, daily, monthly/3-hourly, and monthly averages of surface and top-of atmosphere (TOA) longwave and shortwave radiative parameters.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: NASA/GEWEX Surface Radiation Budget (SRB) Data and Info

Authority: NASA, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, California Institute of Technology,  Jet Propulsion Laboratory,  Infrared Processing and Analysis Center , IPAC
Description: NED is a comprehensive database of multiwavelength data for extragalactic objects, providing a systematic, ongoing fusion of information integrated from hundreds of large sky surveys and tens of thousands of research publications. The contents and services span the entire observed spectrum from gamma rays through radio frequencies. As new observations are published, they are cross- identified or statistically associated with previous data and integrated into a unified database to simplify queries and retrieval. Seamless connectivity is also provided to data in NASA astrophysics mission archives (IRSA, HEASARC, MAST), to the astrophysics literature via ADS, and to other data centers around the world.

Title#info: NASA/IPAC Infrared Science Archive  (for NASAs Infrared and Submillimeter Data) (IRSA)
Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration, NASA, Infrared Processing and Analysis Center, Science and Data Center for Infrared Astronomy , IPAC, California Institute of Technology, CALTECH, Jet Propulsion Laboratory , JPL
Description: IRSA is chartered to curate the calibrated science products from NASAs infrared and sub-millimeter missions, including five major large-area/all-sky surveys. IRSA exploits a re-useable architecture to deploy cost-effective archives for customers, including: the Spitzer Space Telescope; the 2MASS and IRAS all-sky surveys; and multi-mission datasets such as COSMOS, WISE and Planck mission
Deposit: restricted: registration; IRSA Data Validation Tool - http://irsa.ipac.caltech.edu/irsa-dataQA.html
#name: NASA/IPAC Infrared Science Archive  (for NASAs Infrared and Submillimeter Data) (IRSA)

Title#info: National Addiction and HIV Data Archive Program
Authority: ICPSR, Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan [Ann Arbor, MI], National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA), National Institutes of Health (NIH), Office of Behavioral and Social Sciences Research (OBSSR), National Institutes of Health (NIH)
Subjects: HIV (Viruses), Substance abuse, Drug abuse, Diseases
Description: The National Addiction & HIV Data Archive Program (NAHDAP) facilitates research on drug addiction and HIV infection by acquiring, enhancing, preserving, and sharing data produced by research grants, particularly those funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
Access: Open. Some data is restricted-use or available only to persons at ICPSR member institutions. http://www.icpsr.umich.edu/icpsrweb/NAHDAP/data/index.jsp
Reuse: Open. Researchers are encouraged to submit bibliographic citations: http://www.icpsr.umich.edu/icpsrweb/NAHDAP/publications.jsp
#name: National Addiction and HIV Data Archive Program

Authority: United States Department of Agriculture (USDA)
Subjects: Animals, Agriculture--Economic aspects, Produce trade, Livestock, Food supply, Labor, Agricultural chemicals, Research, Maps, Demography, Economics, Crops, Animal products
Description: As a department of the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) the National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) continually surveys and reports on U.S. agriculture.  NASS reports include production and supplies of food and fiber, prices paid and received by farmers, farm labor and wages, farm finances, chemical use, and changes in the demographics of U.S. producers.  NASS provides objective and unbiased statistics of states and counties, while safeguarding the privacy of farmers and ranchers.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Title#info: National Archive of Computerized Data on Aging
Authority: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR) at the Institute for Social Research, the University of Michigan
Subjects: Aging, Gerontology, Age and intelligence, Life span, Productive
Description: The National Archive of Computerized Data on Aging (NACDA), maintains databases relevant data to current gerontological research. Subjects include demographic, social, economic, and psychological characteristics of older adults, physical health and functioning of older adults, and health care needs of older adults.
Access: Open - Some data needs a membership
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: National Archive of Computerized Data on Aging

Title#info: National Archive of Criminal Justice Data
Authority: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research (ICPSR) at the Institute for Social Research, the University of Michigan
Subjects: Social sciences, Law enforcement, Criminology, Criminal justice libraries, Justice and politics, Homicide, Juvenile corrections, Violent crimes, Crime analysis
Description: The National Archive of Criminal Justice Data (NACJD) is intended to be utilized by those seeking to  research or do research in criminology. It uses it's preservation, enhancement, and sharing of computerized data resources to facilitate this intent. Data entries include including community studies, corrections, courts, drugs and alcohol, and police behavior.
#name: National Archive of Criminal Justice Data

Authority: U.S. National Archives and Records Administration, NARA, The USA.gov
Subjects: Jurisprudence, History
Description:
The National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) is the nation's record keeper. Of all documents and materials created in the course of business conducted by the United States Federal government, only 1%-3% are so important for legal or historical reasons that they are kept by us forever.
Those valuable records are preserved and are available to you, whether you want to see if they contain clues about your familyï¿½s history, need to prove a veteranï¿½s military service, or are researching an historical topic that interests you.

Authority: National Archives and Records Administration [NARA]
Subjects: Documents libraries, Genealogical libraries, Photographs, Libraries, Librarians, Archival materials, Archive buildings, Archives, Genealogical libraries
Description: The National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) is the governmental agency that preserves and maintains the collection of documents that record important events in American history.  The NARA preserves the materials and makes them available for research.  An estimated 1%-3% of all documents and materials created in the course of business by the U.S. government are deemed important enough for legal or historical reasons that they are kept in the archive.  Many of the records in the National Archives are available on microfilm, and more than 124,000 digital images of documents can be seen through NARAâs Archival Research Catalog (ARC).

Authority: Environment Canada
Subjects: Rain and rainfall, Atmospheric chemistry, Environmental chemistry, Water purification chemicals industry, Water chemistry, Environmental auditing, Water cycles, Precipitable water, Aerosol propellants--Environmental aspects, Air pollution control industry
Description: The purpose of the National Atmospheric Chemistry (NAtChem) database is to create a research grade database of North American air and precipitation chemistry. These data entries include information about the chemical properties of the atmosphere, atmospheric processes, spatial and temporal patterns, source-receptor relationships and long-range transport of air pollutants.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Illinois State Water Survey
Subjects: Mercury, Atmospheric chemistry, Precipitation (Chemistry), Ammonia--Environmental aspects, Environmental chemistry
Description: The NADP monitors precipitation chemistry from numerous sites around the United States. The NADP consists of 5 networks: National Trends Network, Mercury Deposition Network, Atmospheric Integrated Research Monitoring Network, Atmospheric Mercury Network, and Ammonia Monitoring Network.  Data is provided by each network.

Authority: National Biodiversity Network
Subjects: Biodiversity, Species, Habitat (Ecology), Geography
Description: UK biodiversity data, contributed by a range of data providers, can be explored using the National Biodiversity Networkâs (NBN) Gateway. Species, habitat, and geographic datasets are included. Data entries are primarily organized by general category (e.g., species, habitat, geographic) and then listed by date published.

Authority: University Corporation for Atmospheric Research [Boulder, CO]
Subjects: Atmosphere, Severe storms, Cloud physics, Climatology, Meteorology, Atmospheric carbon dioxide, Earth sciences
Description: The NCAR is a federally funded research and development center committed to research and education in atmospheric science and related scientific fields. NCAR seeks to support and enhance the scientific community nationally and globally by monitoring and researching the atmosphere and related physical and biological systems. Users can access climate and earth models created to better understand the atmosphere, the Earth and the Sun; as well as data from various NCAR research programs and projects. NCAR is sponsored by the National Science Foundation in addition to various other U.S. agencies.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit by University Corporation for Atmospheric Research member institutions

Title#info: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)
Authority: University of California, Santa Barbara
Subjects: Ecology, Climatology, Marine ecology, Economics, Conservation of natural resources, Biodiversity, Diseases, Resource allocation
Description: The National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS) funds cross-disciplinary research in ecology and allied fields.  Data collected from NCEAS research is registered, documented and uploaded using Morpho. NCEAS data are concurrently available through the Knowledge Network for Biocomplexity (KNB).
#name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS)

Authority: Institute of Education Sciences-National Center for Educational Statistics, Department of Education [Washington D.C.]
Subjects: Public libraries, Private schools, Public schools, College choice, Schools--Statistics, Literacy, Statistics, Education
Description: The National Center for Educational Statistics (NCES) is responsible for collecting and analyzing data related to education, including assessing the performance of students from early childhood through secondary education as well as the literacy level of adults and post-secondary education surveys. Users can access data on public and private schools as well as public libraries and a college navigator tool containing information on over 7,000 post-secondary institutions.
Deposit: Accepting data for submission by qualified researchers-http://ies.ed.gov/funding/12rfas.asp

Authority: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics
Subjects: Health, Health status indicators--U.S. states, Health status indicators, Diseases, Health service areas, Medical care
Description: The NCHS collects data from birth and death records, medical records, interview surveys, direct physical exams, and laboratory texting to document the health status of the population; identify disparities in health status and health care use by various population characteristics; monitor trends in health status; identify health problems; support biomedical and health services research; and evaluate the impact of health policies and programs. Its primary mission is to provide the statistical information that can guide and inform policies and actions to improve health in the American population.

Title#info: National Climate Data and Information Archive (NCDC)
Authority: Environment Canada, EC, Government of Canada, GoC
Subjects: Geography
Description: The National Climate Data and Information Archive is a web-based resource maintained by Environment Canada and the Meteorological Service of Canada. The site houses a number of statistical and data compilation and viewing tools. From the website, users can access historical climate data for Canadian locations and dates, view climate normals and averages, and climate summaries. A list of Canadian air stations and their meteorological reports and activities is also available, along with rainfall statistics for more than 500 locations across Canada. Users can also download the Canadian daily climate data for 2006/07. In addition, technical documentation is offered for data users to interpret the available data. Other documentation includes a catalogue of Canadian weather reporting stations, a glossary, and a calculation of the 1971 to 2000 climate normals for Canada. This resource carries authority and accuracy because it is maintained by a national government department and service. While the majority of the statistics are historical, the data is up-to-date and contains current and fairly recent climate data. This government resource is intended for an audience that has the ability and knowledge to interpret climatological data
#name: National Climate Data and Information Archive (NCDC)

Authority: National Climatic Data Center [Asheville, NC]
Subjects: Meteorology, Climatology, Weather forecasting, Severe storms, Environmental sciences, Remote-sensing images
Description: NCDC supports the largest active archive of weather data as well as producing numerous climate publications and operates the World Data Center for Meteorology in Asheville. NCDC provides current hourly information on hazardous weather, climate extremes, and disaster reports; as well as access to interactive maps, weather models and daily updates from weather stations and satellites across the globe. Older weather data is available through the Legacy Access interface and users can order climate publications and reports from the online store, or download them for free via NCDCâs Geodata Portal.

Title#info: National Data Archive on Child Abuse and Neglect
Authority: Cornell University
Subjects: Developmental psychology, Child abuse, Social sciences and psychology
Description: The National Data Archive on Child Abuse and Neglect (NDACAN) promotes scholarly exchange among researchers in the child maltreatment field. NDACAN acquires microdata from leading researchers and national data collection efforts and makes these datasets available to the research community for secondary analysis.
Access: Researchers in the U.S. and territories may order datasets from NDACAN. Access to some datasets in our holdings requires affiliation with an institution that has an Institutional Review Board (IRB). Requests for data from users outside of the U.S. and territories are handled on a case-by-case basis.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit from child maltreatment researchers
#name: National Data Archive on Child Abuse and Neglect

Authority: National Institutes of Health (NIH)
Subjects: Autism, Neurologic examination--Data processing, Behavior disorders in adolescence, Behavior disorders in children
Description: NDAR is an extensible, scalable informatics platform for ASD relevant data at all levels of biological and behavioral organization (molecules, genes, neural tissue, behavioral, social and environmental interactions) and for all data types (text, numeric, image, time series, etc.). NDAR was developed to share data across the entire ASD field and to facilitate collaboration across laboratories, as well as interconnectivity with other informatics platforms.

Authority: The National Archives [Kew, Richmond, Surrey, UK]
Subjects: Public records, Public health, Statistics, Economics, Historical geography
Description: The National Digital Archive of Datasets (NDAD) provides access to archived datasets and documents from United Kingdom government departments which can be searched or browsed by subjects such as armed forces service or wills and death duties. Statistics and information gathered through census data as well as public records are used to compile the available datasets. All datasets are available to download and contain a record summary as well as custodial history, background on the source of the data and whether or not data may be added to the dataset in the future.

Authority: Earthquake Hazards Program, United States Geological Survey (USGS)
Subjects: Seismology, Geology, Earthquakes
Description: National Earthquake Information Center (NEIC) provides global real-time data feeds and archived data of first-motion, moment tensor, radiated energy, Global centroid moment tensor, and scalar moment events.

Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, NEON, Inc.
Subjects: Biology
Description: The National Ecological Observatory Network (NEON) is a continental-scale observatory designed to gather and provide 30 years of ecological data on the impacts of climate change, land use change and invasive species on natural resources and biodiversity. NEON is a project of the National Science Foundation, with many other U.S. agencies and NGOs cooperating.

Authority: University of Bamberg, Institute for Longitudinal Educational Research, Germanyï¿½s Federal Ministry of Education and Research
Subjects: Social sciences, Psychology
Description:
The project analyzes educational processes in Germany from early childhood to late adulthood. The National Educational Panel Study (NEPS) has been set up to find out more about the acquisition of education in Germany, to plot the consequences of education for individual biographies, and to describe central educational processes and trajectories across the entire life span.
Such an interdisciplinary consortium of research institutes, researcher groups, and research
personalities has been assembled in Bamberg. In addition, the competencies and experiences with longitudinal research available at numerous other locations have been networked to form a cluster of excellence.

Authority: Canadian Forest Service (CFS)
Subjects: Forest fires, Sustainability, Forest insects, Forest products industry, Silvicultural systems, Revenue, Pests--Control, Forest management, Fires--Environmental aspects
Description: The National Forestry Database (NFD) is a database that contains the forestry and wildlife information collected by the Canadian Forest Service. NFD data is downloadable as HTML or Excel files, and searchable via reporting agencies, subject, and reporting period.
Deposit: Membership in National Forestry Database partners network

Authority: National Bureau of Plant Genetics Resources, New Delhi
Subjects: Biotechnology, RNA, DNA, Genomics, Genetics, Experimental, Plants, Plants and history, Biotechnology, Chromosomal proteins
Description: National Genomic Resources Repository is established as an institutional framework for methodical and centralized efforts to collect, generate, conserve and distribute genomic resources for agricultural research.

Authority: Satellite and Information Service, NOAA
Subjects: Natural disasters, Water, Remote-sensing images, Snow, Ice, Solar-terrestrial physics, Geology
Description: NGDC provides geophysical data of the solid earth, marine, solar-terrestrial environment, and earth observations from space.   NGDC welcomes scientific data contributions from other government agencies, nonprofit organizations, and universities.

Authority: British Geological Survey, Natural Environment Research Council [Nottingham, England]
Subjects: Geological surveys, Earth sciences, Earthquakes, Geology, Hydrocarbons, Paleontology, Mineralogy
Description: The National Geoscience Data Centre (NGDC) contains the National Hydrocarbons Data Archive as well as the Earth Science Academic Archive and The National Geological Records Centre; providing extensive datasets and geological information going back more than two centuries. The NGDC supports the British Geological Surveyâs science programs and is the designated data center for Earth Sciences in the United Kingdom. Available data includes geological and survey maps, photographs, and geographic information metadata.

Authority: U.S. Department of Energy
Subjects: Energy development, Geothermal resources
Description: The National Geothermal Data System (NGDS) is a distributed data system that provides access to information related to geothermal energy from a network of data providers, including academic researchers, private industry, and state and federal agencies.

Authority: Minnesota Population Center, University of Minnesota
Subjects: Census, Population, Geographic information systems, Household surveys, Demography
Description: The NHGIS provides free summary (aggregate) data from the US Census Bureau from 1790 to the present from several census programs including the decennial census, American Community Survey, and County Business Patterns. Users can also download historical census geography boundary files for use in GIS. Registration is required but is free.

Authority: United States Department of the Interior (DOI), Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement (OSM)
Subjects: Maps, Geology--Maps, Mines and mineral resources, Map catalogers, Map collections
Description: The National Mine Map Repository (NMMR) collects, maintains, and provides U.S. coal and non-coal mine maps to individuals, public and private sectors.  NMMR mine maps and data are searchable and indexed by state, county, company name, and mine name.  Accessing NMMR mine maps and data requires contacting NMMR.  NMMR has a diverse customer population and has provided data to efforts supporting industrial and commercial development, highway construction, and the preservation of public health, safety and welfare.

Authority: National Nuclear Data Center, Brookhaven National Laboratory
Subjects: Nuclear physics, Atomic mass, Nuclides, Nuclear isobars, Nuclear isomers, Isotopes, Nuclear structure, Nuclear reactions
Description: The NNDC is a worldwide resource that collects, evaluates, and disseminates nuclear physics data for basic nuclear research and for applied nuclear technologies. Its specialties include nuclear structure and low-energy nuclear reactions, nuclear databases and information technology, and nuclear data compilation and evaluation.

Authority: National Nuclear Data Center, Brookhaven National Laboratory
Subjects: Radiotherapy, Nuclear medicine, Nuclides
Description: Searchable nuclide data from the Evaluated Nuclear Structure Data File (ENSDF)  is converted into Medical Internal Radiation Dose (MIRD) format. The NNDC specializes in nuclear structure and low-energy nuclear reactions, nuclear databases and information technology, and nuclear data compilation and evaluation.
Deposit: Members of the of the National Nuclear Data Center, US Nuclear Data Program, and Partners

Authority: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
Subjects: Atmosphere, Climatology, Plankton, Glaciers, Oceanography, Ocean currents, Marine biology, Coral reefs and islands, Geographic information systems, Waves, Chlorophyll, Sea level, Nautical charts
Description: NODC provides access to national and international marine environmental and ecosystem data obtained from domestic and foreign research monitoring environmentally-based global changes.  Users can access data on physical, biological and chemical measurements derived from oceanographic observations, simulations and satellite remote sensing of the worldâs oceans.  Several NODC ocean-data web applications can be accessed through the NODC database including Coastal Buoy Data, Coastal Water Temperatures, Satellite Oceanography and the Shipboard Sensor Database, among others.

Authority: National Science Foundation (NSF)
Subjects: Education, Mathematics, Science, Teachers, Manipulatives (Education)
Description: The NSDL provides open access to multiple educational resource types, media, and materials from multiple providers, in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics, at all education levels

Title#info: National Science Foundation (NSF) Ultraviolet (UV) Monitoring Network
Authority: Biospherical Instruments Inc.
Subjects: Ozone, Ozone layer, Ultraviolet radiation, Spectroradiometer, Radiometers, Environmental responsibility, Climate change mitigation
Description: The National Science Foundation (NSF) Ultraviolet (UV) Monitoring Network provides data on ozone depletion and the associated effects on terrestrial and marine systems.  Data are collected from sites in Antarctica, Argentina, United States, and Greenland.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)
#name: National Science Foundation (NSF) Ultraviolet (UV) Monitoring Network

Title#info: National Snow and Ice Data Center
Authority: Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Sciences (CIRES)
Subjects: Antarctica, Arctic Regions, Snow, Sea ice, Satellites, Ice sheets, Ice, Global warming, Glaciers, Frozen ground, Cryosphere, Climatology, Arctic peoples
Description:
The National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC, http://nsidc.org) supports research into our world's frozen realms: the snow, ice, glaciers, frozen ground, and climate interactions that make up Earth's cryosphere. NSIDC manages and distributes scientific data, creates tools for data access, supports data users, performs scientific research, and educates the public about the cryosphere.

Users may search for data in NSIDC's entire online data catalog using the NSIDC Data Search tool, or you may want to use one of the specialized search and access tools listed below, which will help you discover, visualize, access, or search-and-order certain data without searching NSIDC's entire online catalog.  Data sets are organized into the following groups sea ice, frozen ground, snow cover, snow hydrology, glaciers and ice sheets, arctic people.
#name: National Snow and Ice Data Center

Authority: National Aeronautics and Space Administration -Solar System Exploration Division, Goddard Space Flight Center [Greenbelt, MD]
Subjects: Planets, Astronomy, Space sciences, Planetary scientists, Astrophysics, Atmosphere, Upper
Description: The National Space Science Data Center (NSSDC) is the National Aeronautics and Space Administrationâs (NASA) permanent archive for space science mission data. Users can browse data from space science disciplines such as Universe Exploration, Heliophysics and Solar System Exploration. The database also contains an Image Resources section with access to a variety of NASA images. Available data includes NASA press releases regarding ongoing projects as well as directories, catalogs and access to widely distributed and archived space science data. The NSSDC Master Catalog contains multiple interfaces to query data by Spacecraft, Experiment, Data Collection, Lunar and Planetary Maps or Events as well as Publications and Personnel.
Deposit: Accepting data for submission from individuals and projects meeting specified criteria- http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nssdc/submitting_data.html

Authority: Landcare Research New Zealand Ltd1593
Subjects: Vegetation surveys--Methodology, Vegetation surveys--Data processing, Plant communities--Measurement, Vegetation monitoring, Vegetation surveys, New Zealand
Description: The National Vegetation Survey (NVS) Databank is a physical archive and electronic databank containing records of over 94,000 vegetation survey plots - including data from over 19,000 permanent plots in New Zealand. The data can be explored online and requested for download. The NVS Databank provides data spanning more than 60 years of indigenous and exotic plant plot records from throughout New Zealand's terrestrial ecosystems. The physical archive includes plot sheets, maps, and photographs from many years of vegetation surveys. Purpose-built software for entering, validating and summarising data is available.  NVS is accorded the status of a Nationally Significant database and upkeep and maintenance is supported by Core funding for Crown Research Institutes from the NZ Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment.
Access: Open Access to metadata. Closed Access to data; registered users can request and download datasets. (https://nvs.landcareresearch.co.nz/about/index/?id=about-gettingstarted)
Reuse: Open single-use with attribution cited.  Redistribution Closed by data-use agreement (see NVS Protocol - https://nvs.landcareresearch.co.nz/About/Index)

Title#info: National Weather Service, Alaska Region Headquarters
Authority: National Weather Service, NOAA
Subjects: Meteorology, Precipitation (Meteorology), Weather, Advisory boards--U.S. states, Interior Alaska (Alaska), Arctic Regions, Bering Sea, Weather forecasting
Description: This site contains active weather alerts, warnings, watches, and advisories concerning the US State of Alaska and the surrounding waters. Near-real time data are available as are historical records. Links to the National Data Buoy Center are provided for coastal and ocean conditions around Alaska.
#name: National Weather Service, Alaska Region Headquarters

Authority: National Weather Service, NOAA
Subjects: Meteorology, Weather forecasting, Weather, Advisory boards--U.S. states, Fairbanks (Alaska), Precipitation (Meteorology), Forecasting, Marine biology, Hydrology, Rivers--Economic aspects, Weather control
Description: The National Weather Service, Fairbanks provides weather data relating to and observed in the Fairbanks, AK area. Data includes current, past, and future weather. Databases are organized primarily by the type of data (e.g. weather data, climate data, hydrology, warning/hazard alerts)  and then are searchable by research location.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources (MNR), The Nature Conservancy of Canada, Natural Heritage League, The Nature Conservancy
Subjects: Biodiversity, Botany, Natural areas, Nature conservation, Environmental policy, Environmental sciences
Description: The Natural Heritage Information Centre (NHIC) is an Ontario-based data repository that was created to catalog and maintain databases on the ecological data of Ontario's ecosystems. The NHIC makes data available on Ontarioâs rare species, vegetation communities, and natural areas.
Deposit: Accepting data for deposit. Rare Species: http://nhic.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/nhic/species/species_report.cfm. Plant Communities: http://nhic.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/nhic/communities/comm_report.cfm

Authority: U.S. National Park Service, U.S. Department of the Interior
Subjects: Geospatial data, Geographical positions, Cartographic materials, Altitudes, Contours (Cartography), Distances, Latitude, Longitude
Description: The Natural Resource GIS Program coordinates GIS implementation within the NRSS, Regions, and NPS Units, as well as partnerships with other agencies and organizations; enables and manages joint and collaborative geospatial data development; manages Natural Resource and I&M GIS data acquisition; plans the spatial data clearinghouse; and develops and coordinates GIS and information management plans, standards, and policies. Its primary aim is to provide geographic data for management of park resources and park planning.

Authority: NatureServe
Subjects: Zoology, Life sciences
Description: NatureServe and its network of member programs are a leading source for reliable scientific information about species and ecosystems of the Western Hemisphere. This site serves as a portal for accessing several types of publicly available biodiversity data. The Explorer lists 70,000 plants, animals, and ecological communities of the United States and Canada

Authority: Naval Meteorology and Oceanography Command
Subjects: Ice, Oceanography, Meteorology, Astronomy, Time, Ocean color, Sea ice, Environmental impact analysis, Climate change mitigation
Description: The Naval Oceanography Portal (NOP) is maintained by U.S. Naval Meteorology and Oceanography Command (NMOC). The NOP provides astronomical, meteorological, oceanic and atmospheric data to military, scientific, and civilian communities.  All data is provided as a public service and maybe distributed or copied unless otherwise specified.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: North Carolina Geographic Information Coordinating Council (GICC)
Subjects: Geospatial data, Geographic information systems, Social sciences, Environmental sciences, Roads, Communication
Description: NC OneMap provides data and metadata of North Carolina's natural environments and built infrastructure for the benefit of government, business, and the public.
Deposit: Membership in North Carolina's private sector, academia, local, state, and federal government agencies

Authority: National Collegiate Athletic Association, Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research
Subjects: College sports, Sports, Athletics, Physical therapists
Description: The NCAA Student-Athlete Experiences Data Archive provides access to data about student athletes. The data is used by college presidents, athletic personnel, faculty, student-athlete groups, media members, and researchers in looking at issues related to intercollegiate athletics and higher education.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Gene mapping, Gene expression, Genomes, Biology, Biological tags, Gene rearrangement, Genetic algorithms, Genetic code, Genetic genealogy
Description: The BioProject repository collects projects with biological data that relates to a single initiative that originates from a single entity or consortium. Records provide users with a single location for the links to diverse data types generated for those projects.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Proteins, Genes, Molecules
Description: The repository facilitates computation of  a wide range of biosystem data. It also connects biosystem data with associated literature throughout the Entrez system.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Proteins--Biotechnology, Amino acid sequence, Nucleic acids, Bioinformatics
Description: The Conserved Domains Database (CDD) contains annotations of functional units in proteins; including multiple sequence alignment models for ancient domains and full-length proteins. This collection of models includes 3D structures that display the sequence/structure/function relationships in proteins. Users can identify amino acids in protein sequences with the resources available through CDD as well as view single sequences embedded within multiple sequence alignments.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Homology (Biology), Cells--Morphology, Morphology, Genotype-environment interaction, Phenotype, Molecular diagnosis, Genetic recombination
Description: The NCBI database of Genotypes and Phenotypes archives and distributes the results of studies that have investigated the interaction of genotype and phenotype, including genome-wide association studies, medical sequencing, molecular diagnostic assays, and association between genotype and non-clinical traits. The database provides summaries of studies, the contents of measured variables, and original study document text. dbGaP provides two types of access for users, open and controlled. Through the controlled access, users may access individual-level data such as phenotypic data tables and genotypes.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Bioinformatics, Gene expression, DNA, Genomics, Phenotype, Genetic code
Description: The dbVar is a database of genomic structural variation containing data from multiple gene studies. Users can browse data containing the number of variant cells from each study, and filter studies by organism, study type, method and genomic variant. Organisms include human, mouse, cattle and several additional animals.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Bioinformatics, DNA, Gene mapping, Gene amplification, Genetic code, Gene libraries, DNA fingerprinting, Histones, Chromatin, Genomics
Description: The Epigenomics database provides genomics maps of stable and reprogrammable nuclear changes that control gene expression and influence health. Users can browse current epigenomic experiments as well as search, compare and browse samples from multiple biological sources in gene-specific contexts. Many epigenomes contain modifications with histone marks, DNA methylation and chromatin structure activity. NCBI Epigenomics database contains datasets from the NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Project.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: RNA--Analysis, DNA, DNA fingerprinting, Gene expression, Biotechnology industries, Bioinformatics, Nucleic acids, Gene frequency, Genetic regulation
Description:
The EST (Expressed Sequence Tag) database collects single-read nucleotide sequences. The majority of these entries are derived from GenBank. This data bank serves as a tool and resource to analyze gene expressions, locate possible variations, and annotate genes. Entries are updated regularly by multiple research institutes and organizations. Each entries includes raw data about the sequence being analyzed, information about the person and environment the data was collected in, and citations for the researcher and the data repository holding the research.
The raw data of the entry  contains nucleic acid sequences and uncharacterized, short cDNA sequences.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Biology--Nomenclature, Gene mapping, Phenotype, Species, Proteins, Bioinformatics, Biotechnology, Gene expression, Genetic code
Description: The NCBI Gene databse compiles  data on a variety of species of genes. An entry may include nomenclature, reference sequences, maps, pathways, variations, phenotypes, and/or web links to other international databases. All entries follow the NCBI's format for data collections.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Gene mapping, DNA
Description: The Genome database contains annotations and analysis of eukaryotic and prokaryotic genomes, as well as tools that allow users to compare genomes and gene sequences from humans, microbes, plants, viruses and organelles. Users can browse by organism, and view genome maps and protein clusters.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Gene expression, Gene frequency, Population genetics, Genetic regulation
Description: An international public repository, GEO (Gene Expression Omnibus) DataSets archives and distributes microarray, next-generation sequencing, and other forms of high-throughput functional genomics data. The records include original submitter-supplied records (Series, Samples and Platforms) and curated DataSets. GEO aims to provide a database that efficiently store this data; offer simple submission procedures and formats that support complete and well-annotated data deposits from the research community; and provide user-friendly mechanisms for users to find and use studies and gene expression profiles of interest. GEO DataSets provides tools to identify differences in gene expression levels and cluster heatmaps.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Genomics, Gene expression, DNA, Bioinformatics, RNA
Description: The Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) database stores individual gene expression profiles from NCBI databases and is searchable by gene annotation as well as gene profile characteristics. GEO archives microarray and next-generation sequencing as well as other forms of genomic data submitted by researchers within the scientific community.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Homology (Biology), Nucleic acids, Nucleotide sequence, DNA
Description: The GSS database collects unannotated, short, single-read, primary genomic sequences from GenBank and contains nucleic acid sequences. These sequences include random survey sequences, clone-end sequences, and exon-trapped sequences.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Amino acid sequence, Phenotype, Genomes, Eukaryotic cells, DNA, Homology (Biology), Bioinformatics, Biotechnology
Description: The HomoloGene database provides a system for the automated detection of homologs among annotated genes of genomes across multiple species. These homologs are fully documented and organized by homology group. HomoloGene processing uses proteins from input organisms to compare and sequence homologs, mapping back to corresponding DNA sequences.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Genomics, Genomes, Influenza viruses--Variation, Influenza viruses
Description: This resource allows users to search for and compare influenza virus genomes and gene sequences taken from GenBank. It also provides a virus sequence annotation tool and links to other influenza resources.
Deposit: Closed - all sequences come from the Influenza Genome Sequencing Project at The J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI) - http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genomes/FLU/overview.html

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Bioinformatics, Gene expression, Genomics, Molecular biology, Nucleic acids, Biological assay
Description: The NCBI Nucleotide database collects sequences from such sources as GenBank, RefSeq, TPA, and PDB. Sequences collected relate to genome, gene, and transcript sequence data, and provide a foundation for research related to the biomedical field.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Bioinformatics, DNA, Genomics, Eukaryotic cells
Description: NCBI PopSet collects DNA sequences to analyze the ways that populations are related by evolution. Such sequences indicate if populations originate from different members of the same species or from organisms of different species entirely.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Gene expression, Gene mapping, Gene silencing, DNA data banks, Nucleic acid probes
Description: Probe database provides a public registry of nucleic acid reagents as well as information on reagent distributors, sequence similarities and probe effectiveness. Database users have access to applications of gene expression, gene silencing and mapping, as well as reagent variation analysis and projects based on probe-generated data. The Probe database is constantly updated, with over 11,000,000 probes available.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: DNA, Nucleotide sequence, Genomics, Protein binding, Bioinformatics
Description: The Protein database collects protein sequences related to biological structure and function. The sequences in NCBI Protein come from the translations from annotated coding regions in GenBank, RefSeq, and TPA, and records from SwissProt, PIR, PRF, and PDB.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Plasmids, Genomics, Bioinformatics, Phylogeny, Nucleotide sequence, Chloroplasts, DNA
Description: The Entrez Protein Clusters database contains annotation information, publications, structures and analysis tools for related protein sequences encoded by complete genomes. The data available in the Protein Clusters Database is generated from prokaryotic genomic studies and is intended to assist researchers studying micro-organism evolution as well as other biological sciences.  Available genomes include plants and viruses as well as organelles and microbial genomes.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Molecular biology, Nucleotide sequence, DNA, Gene expression, Genomes, Biotechnology
Description: RefSeq database provides explicitly linked nucleotide and protein sequences, as well as comprehensive and annotated sequence sets with genomic DNA, proteins and transcripts.  Users have access to a wealth of resources for gene identification, comparative analysis and genome research.  Reference Sequences are available for naturally occurring DNA, RNA and protein sequences in organic species worldwide including plasmids, organelles, viruses, archaea, bacteria, and eukaryotes.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Biotechnology, Macromolecules--Analysis, Biological systems, Biomolecules
Description: The Structure database provides three-dimensional structures of macromolecules for a variety of research purposes and allows the user to retrieve structures for specific molecule types as well as structures for genes and proteins of interest. Three main databases comprise Structure-The Molecular Modeling Database; Conserved Domains and Protein Classification; and the BioSystems Database. Structure also links to the PubChem databases to connect biological activity data to the macromolecular structures. Users can locate structural templates for proteins and interactively view structures and sequence data to closely examine sequence-structure relationships.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Biology--Nomenclature, Cladistic analysis, Biology--Classification, Animals--Classification, Bioinformatics
Description: Currently covering about 10 percent of the described species on the planet and more than 175,000 taxa, Taxonomy is a curated classification and nomenclature for all organisms in the public sequence databases. Taxonomy gives species names and higher-level classifications of the organisms represented in the Entrez sequence databases. It maintains a phylogenetic classification (containing only monophyletic groups if possible). Most species are represented only by a small piece of sequence data that's insufficient to construct a full phylogeny, but some species contain complete genomes.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Biology, Genes, Gene expression, Nucleotide sequence, Bioinformatics
Description: TPA is a database that contains sequences built from the existing primary sequence data in GenBank. TPA records are retrieved through the Nucleotide Database and feature information on the sequence, how it was cataloged, and proper way to cite the sequence information.
Deposit: Sequence can be submitted to the Open: TPA database through either BankIt or Sequin. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/WebSub/?tool=genbank; http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Sequin/

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Biology, Genomes, Genomics, DNA, Biological systems, Nucleotide sequence
Description: The Trace Assembly Archive stores pairwise alignment and multiple alignment of sequencing reads, linking basic trace data with finished genomic sequence.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: West Nile virus, Dengue viruses, Influenza viruses, Rotaviruses
Description: NCBI Virus Variation is a specialized database which collects tools to provide searchable resources in the fields of Influenza virus, Dengue virus, and West Nile virus. Specific BLAST databases are listed. Their new publications are also available in their site. Rotavirus database will be added in their site soon.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Histocompatibility, Leucocytes
Description: The dbMHC database provides an open, publicly accessible platform for DNA and clinical data related to the human Major Histocompatibility Complex (MHC). The dbMHC provides access to human leukocyte antigen (HLA) sequences, HLA allele and haplotype frequencies, and clinical datasets.

Authority: National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), United States National Library of Medicine (NLM), National Institutes of Health (NIH)  [Bethesda, MD]
Subjects: Genetic polymorphisms, Nucleotides, Genetics, Bioinformatics, Biochemical engineering
Description: The Single Nucleotide Polymorphism database (dbSNP) is a public archive for a collection of genetic polymorphisms. The database contains a range of molecular variation, including SNPs, short deletion and insertion polymorphisms, microsatellite markers, multinucleotide polymorphisms, heterozygous sequences, and named variants.

Title#info: NDAR (National Database fï¿½r Autism Research) (Serving the autism research community)
Authority: National Institutes of Health, National Institute for Mental Health , NIMH, Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development , NICHD, National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke , NINDS, National Institute for Environmental Health Sciences , NIEHS, National Institutes of Health, Center for Information Technology, CIT
Subjects: Neurosciences, Medicine
Description: The National Database for Autism Research (NDAR) is an NIH-funded research data repository that aims to accelerate progress in autism spectrum disorders (ASD) research through data sharing, data harmonization, and the reporting of research results. NDAR also serves as a scientific community platform and portal to multiple other research repositories, allowing for aggregation and secondary analysis of data. NDAR combines the function of a data repository, which holds genetic, phenotypic, clinical, and medical imaging data, and the function of a scientific community platform, which defines the standard tools and policies to integrate the computational resources developed by scientific research institutions, private foundations, and other federal and state agencies supporting ASD research. Furthermore, NDAR is working to develop the means to connect relevant repositories together through data federation.
Reuse: restricted; other - Data Use Certification for the National Database for Autism Research Central Repository
Deposit: restricted: other; Central Repository Data Submission Request - http://ndar.nih.gov/ndarpublicweb/Documents/NDAR%20Submission%20Request.pdf
#name: NDAR (National Database fï¿½r Autism Research) (Serving the autism research community)

Title#info: NDSF Data Portal (National Deep Submergence Facility)
Authority: National Science Foundation, NSF, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, NOAA, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, WHOI, Office of Naval Research, ONR, Columbia University, Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, LDEO, University-National Oceanographic Laboratory System, UNOLS
Description:
The National Deep Submergence Facility (NDSF) operates the Human Occupied
Vehicle (HOV) Alvin, the Remote Operated Vehicle (ROV) Jason 2, and the Autonomous
Underwater Vehicle (AUV) Sentry. Data acquired with these platforms is provided
both to the science party on each expedition, and to the Woods Hole
Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) Data Library.
#name: NDSF Data Portal (National Deep Submergence Facility)

Authority: Natural Environment Research Council [Wallingford, Oxfordshire, UK]
Subjects: Remote-sensing images, Geography, Global Observing System (Meteorology), Ecology
Description: The NERC Earth Observation Data Centre archives and provides access to remotely sensed information from satellite and airborne sensors about the surface of the Earth. NERC serves as a resource for those concerned with environmental research, survey and long-term monitoring.

Authority: University of Victoria
Subjects: Ocean, Oceanography, Ocean bottom ecology, Ocean temperature, Weather forecasting, Underwater surveillance
Description: NEPTUNE (North-East Pacific Time-series Undersea Networked Experiments) Canada is the worldâs first regional-scale underwater ocean observatory network that plugs directly into the Internet. Data from hundreds of scientific instruments and sensors is available. VENUS is NEPTUNEâs sister project.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Title#info: NERC Data Catalogue Service (Natural Environment Research Council DCS) (NERC DCS)
Authority: Natural Environment Research Council, NERC
Subjects: Geophysics, Geography, History
Description: The DCS allows you to search a catalogue of metadata (information describing data) to discover and gain access to NERC's data holdings and information products. The metadata are prepared to a common NERC Metadata Standard and are provided to the catalogue by the NERC Data Centres.
#name: NERC Data Catalogue Service (Natural Environment Research Council DCS) (NERC DCS)

Authority: National Centre for Earth Observation, NCEO
Subjects: Geography
Description: The NERC Earth Observation Data Centre (NEODC) is a Designated Data Centre of the Natural Environment Research Council (NERC) and as such it is tasked with the acquisition, archiving and provision of access to remotely sensed data of the surface of the Earth acquired by satellite and airborne sensors. The NEODC also acts as a source of information regarding Earth Observation data generally and its application to environmental research and survey with the provision of guidance and advice, as appropriate, on matters of copyright, policy and strategy with regard to specific NERC EO data resources.

Authority: NERC Biomolecular Analysis Facility (NBAF)
Subjects: Environmental sciences, Biology, Proteomics, Bioinformatics, Molecular biology
Description: The NERC Environmental Bioinformatics Centre (NEBC) provides environmental molecular data enabled for discovery and interoperability through a standards and ontologies practice coined as 'The 'Env Initiative.'   Additionally, NEBC provides documentation, analysis, and exchange applications for environmental researchers.
Deposit: Credentialed individuals in environmental and/or molecular research

Authority: National Science Foundation (NSF), Purdue University Discovery Park
Subjects: Earthquake damage, Earthquakes, Earthquake hazard analysis, Seismology, Seismites, Tsunami damage, Tsunamis, Engineering
Description: The George E. Brown, Jr. Network for Earthquake Engineering Simulation (NEES) aims to assist in the development of innovations related to construction and design that minimizes or prevents damage during natural disasters such as earthquakes or tsunamis. The NEES provides access to 14 shared-use laboratories that support experimental work in such areas as geotechnical centrifuge research, shake table tests, large-scale structural testing, tsunami wave basin experiments, and field site research.

Authority: Krasnow Institute for Advanced Study, George Mason University [Fairfax, VA]
Subjects: Neurogenetics, Neurochemistry, Neurosciences, Neurology
Description: NeuroMorpho provides an inventory of digitally reconstructed neurons originating from peer-reviewed publications contributed by more than 60 laboratories worldwide. Containing over 7,000 cells, NeuroMorpho is continuously updated with 3-dimensional reconstructions and allows users to browse by species, brain region, cell type or lab name. Users can also download morphological reconstructions for research and analysis.

Authority: National Institutes of Health (NIH)
Subjects: Cerebral circulation, Neurons, Antibody diversity, Neurosciences, Neuroanatomy, Atlas (Vertebra)
Description: The Neuroscience Information Framework is a dynamic inventory of Web-based neuroscience resources: data, materials, and tools accessible via any computer connected to the Internet. An initiative of the NIH Blueprint for Neuroscience Research, NIF advances neuroscience research by enabling discovery and access to public research data and tools worldwide through an open source, networked environment.

Authority: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
Subjects: Respiratory agents, Maternal and infant welfare, Diabetes, Cancer, United States, Health
Description: The NHQR State Snapshots program is a database dedicated to improving the healthcare system within the United States by collecting information on the health care systems on a state by state basis. This information is accessible to state officials and their private and public section partners.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: RTI International for the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)
Subjects: Diabetes, Digestive organs, Kidneys
Description: One of three central repositories of the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases that includes datasets and samples from NIDDK-funded studies. Repositories enable scientists not involved in the original study to test new hypotheses without any new data or biospecimen collection, and they provide the opportunity to pool data across several studies to increase the power of statistical analyses. In addition, most NIDDK-funded studies are collecting genetic biospecimens and carrying out high-throughput genotyping making it possible for other scientists to use repository resources to match genotypes to phenotypes and to perform informative genetic analyses.

Authority: National Institute of Standard and Technology1561
Subjects: Biometric identification--Data processing, Chemistry, Analytic--Standards, Mass spectrometry, Fingerprints, Fluid dynamics, Oxide ceramics, Thermodynamics, Phase diagrams, Fluid dynamics, Crystallography, Biotechnology
Description: NIST Data Gateway - provides easy access to many (currently over 90) of the NIST scientific and technical databases. These databases cover a broad range of substances and properties from many different scientific disciplines. The Gateway includes links to free online NIST data systems as well as to information on NIST PC databases available for purchase.
Access: Most database are free/open.  Some are available for purchase or via subscription.

Authority: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
Subjects: Atoms, Molecules, Biomolecules, Radiation, Physics, Semiconductors, Metrology, Quantum electronics, Photonics, Biophysics, Radioactivity, Temperature, Humidity, Ultraviolet radiation, Astrophysics, Chemistry, Electronics, Telecommunication, Climatology, Manufactures
Description: The Physical Measurement Laboratory (PML) provides access to data related to national standards of length, mass, force, shock, acceleration, time, frequency, electricity, temperature, humidity, pressure, vacuum, liquid flow, and gas flow, as well as electromagnetic, optical, microwave, acoustic, ultrasonic, and ionizing radiation. It aims to support research endeavors in communications, defense, electronics, energy, environment, health, lighting, manufacturing, microelectronics, radiation, remote sensing, space, and transportation. PML establishes methods and standards for different radiations, investigates the structures of atoms and molecules, develops metrology, and examines the properties of fluids and solids.

Authority: University of Cologne
Subjects: Chemistry, Nuclear magnetic resonance, Spectrum analysis, Molecular structure, Molecular spectroscopy
Description: nmrshiftdb2 is a nuclear magnetic resonance database providing data on organic structures and their spectra.  nmrshiftdb2 features peer-reviewed submission of datasets, spectrum prediction, and searchable collection of spectra, structures and properties.

Authority: National Weather Service, NOAA301
Subjects: Meteorology--Research--International cooperation, Meteorology--Research, Meteorology--Data processing, Meteorology--Remote sensing, Meteorology, Weather forecasting
Description:
NWS/NCEP/Climate Prediction Center delivers climate prediction, monitoring, and diagnostic products for timescales from weeks to years to the Nation and the global community for the protection of life and property and the enhancement of the economy. The  goal of the CPC website is to provide easy and comprehensive access to data and products that serve our mission.
We  serve a broad audience ranging from government to non-government entities like academia, NGOâs, and the public and private sectors.  Specific sectors include agriculture, energy, health, transportation, emergency managers, etc.

Title#info: NOAA National Coastal Data Development Center
Authority: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
Subjects: Oceanography, Coastal ecology
Description: The National Coastal Data Development Center, a division of the National Oceanographic Data Center, is dedicated to building the long-term coastal data record to support environmental prediction, scientific analysis, and formulation of public policy.
#name: NOAA National Coastal Data Development Center

Title#info: NOAA: National Geophysical Data Center (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) (NGDC)
Authority: National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration, NOAA, US Department of Commerce, USDOC, National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service, NESDIS
Subjects: Oceanography
Description: NGDC provides stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from our Sun to Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.
#name: NOAA: National Geophysical Data Center (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) (NGDC)

Authority: Nobeyama Radio Observatory, NAOJ
Description: Nobeyama Radio Polarimeters (NoRP) are observing the Sun with multiple frequencies in the microwave range. It is capable to obtain the total coming flux and the circular-polarization degree.

Authority: National Astronomical Observatory of Japan
Subjects: Solar activity, Radio interferometers, Polarimetry, Heliograph, X-ray telescopes, Spectrograph, Radio astronomy, Physics
Description: Nobeyama Solar Radio Observatory provides data from the Nobeyama Radioheliograph (NoRH) radio telescope, and Nobeyama Radio Polarimeters (NoRP).  NoRH is a radio interferometer of 84 parabolic antennas thus data is a correlation of values corresponding to the spatial Fourier components of the brightness distribution of the solar disk. NoRP observes the Sun with multiple frequencies in the microwave range obtaining total coming flux and the circular-polarization degree.
Deposit: Closed (Responsible organization only, no outside submissions)

Authority: Jewish Federations of North America, University of Connecticut Center for Judaic Studies and Contemporary Jewish Life, Roper Center for Public Opinion Research
Subjects: Jews, Demography
Description: Archives and makes available electronically questionnaires, reports and data files from the National Jewish Population Surveys (NJPS) of 1971, 1990 and 2000-01. It is provides access to other national Jewish population reports, Jewish population statistics and approximately 200 local Jewish community studies from the major Jewish communities in North America.

Authority: North Eastern Development Finance Corporation Ltd.
Subjects: Culture and tourism, India, Culture, Economics, Natural resources, Agriculture, Tourism, Infrastructure (Economics), Industry and education, Energy conservation
Description: A databank on the economy, agriculture, tourism, infrastructure, industry, and natural resources of the North Eastern Region of India; comprises seven states namely Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim, Tripura (popularly known as Seven Sisters of India). The region (holds 7.9% of the total land space of the country) is of strategic importance for the country on account of the fact that nearly 90% of its borders form India's international boundaries. Thus information about population distribution, migration of peoples, vast natural resources, literacy rate, infrastructure development, cultural diversity, economy, etc. of this region are quite different from rest of the country.NER databank intends to provide information on multifarious activities of North Eastern states of India, thereby make it accessible to social commons. The North East Databank is a web portal created to provide a regional resource database for the North Eastern Region (NER).

Authority: Norwegian government
Subjects: Svalbard (Norway), Meteorology, Sea ice, Oceanography, Arctic Regions, Weather forecasting, Weather
Description: The Norwegian Meteorological Institute supplies climate observation and weather data and forecasts for the country and surrounding waters.

Authority: Norwegian Social Science Data Service, NSD
Subjects: Social sciences
Description: NSD is one of the largest archives for research data of its kind and provides data to researchers and students in Norway and abroad. Additionally, NSD is a resource centre, which assists researchers with regard to data gathering, data analysis, and issues of methodology, privacy and research ethics. The main objective is to improve possibilities and working conditions for empirical research that is primarily dependent on the access to data.
